user_review: We were on the hunt for some Crepes, we went to a less then ideal place the day before that put candied marshmallows in crepe, bleh, so gross! I was wiser in my revision, this time we ordered Nutella and strawberries! It was divine! I did not know I've cream was included which made it even sweeter! Bill came to $16 before tip, very reasonable for old Montreal! Their patio was packed with safety measures in place because of covid! I will definitely frequent this place!

+.5 for serviceIt was a snowy morning when my family came here for breakfast during the holidays. My parents have been here before and highly recommend the French Onion Soup. Since we came for breakfast, I also ordered a crepe and shared a fondue with my parents.I had La Spéciale Delice crepe, which consisted of scrambled eggs, bacon, ham, cheese, and mushrooms. In addition to the French Onion Soup, I shared the Swiss Fondue with my parents. The soup was excellent, definitely one of the best I had. The crepe was decent but not the best I've had. Definitely one of the sweeter ones I've had if that's what you like. The fondue, however, didn't taste right. While I was expecting swiss cheese, it tasted nothing like it and when I asked a server, he said it was gruyere cheese. Never had it before, but if that was what it usually tastes like, I'll pass for next time.Service was excellent despite how busy the place was. I'll stick with the soup and crepe, but maybe pass on the swiss fondue next time.

This restaurant sits right in the heart of Old Montreal. They have an expansive menu offering all sorts of crepes, from savoury to sweet, as a wide selection of sandwiches, desserts, and fondue!I came here to try out their crepes. In addition to this, we also ordered a fondue set to accompany our meal. The list of items we ordered are: - Escargots in Garlic Butter Sauce - Montrealaise Crepe- Chicken Supreme Crepe- Swiss Fondue with White Wine and KirshI loved the snails. The garlic butter sauce gives it a pleasant aroma. The texture is snappy, and not chewy. Our crepes, which were ladled with a creamy bechamel sauce finally arrived. The Montrealaise crepe is stuffed with ham and swiss cheese. This combination is simple, yet very delicious. There was a hint of sweetness from the crepe, but otherwise, it was overall a creamy and savoury crepe. The chicken supreme crepe was filled with juicy and tender chicken, mushrooms and a parmesan bechamel sauce. This combination also worked out very well. I liked the soft bites of chicken with the savoury mushrooms. I liked the common theme of simplicity in their crepes. With respect to the swiss fondue, I had very opposing views for this dish. The taste of wine was too strong for me. The bread they served it with was also stale and cold. It wasn't the best experience trying fondue for the first time. I found the fondue to be a bit too salty and almost bitter at times. The winey aftertaste is something that was hard for me to swallow. I probably will try a different flavoured fondue base next time. On the bright side, the apples they served us paired quite well with the fondue! I never knew fruits and cheese could go so well with each other.
Pretty good French food but in Montreal there are quite a few great places, which makes this place a bit more average but still a solid choice for food.

Sometimes you do lots of hours of research and yelping before deciding on a restaurant... and sometimes you keep an open mind and walk in wherever looks good, fully aware of all risks and consequences of such a bold move. This is a story with a happy ending of the latter situation.We were roped in with enticing pictures and promises of crepes and fondue. We fell in love with their warm (spiced and spiked) ciders and fanfkingtastic french onion soups. We stuffed ourselves with way too much cheese, and just when we thought we could not take any more... we voluntarily did further damage with fruits & marshmallows dipped in gooey chocolate. Everyone left this place many pounds heavier, but many memories fuller. Also this place is 3 stories huge (top is the best) and the staff is just so super awesome.

This creperie is located in Old Montreal. We were seated on the top story and had a nice view of the street.Lots of crepes to choose from. Portion sizes were large. You could easily split a crepe between two people. Tried the shrimp crepe with lobster sauce, the Neptune crepe, and la symphonie sweet crepe. The shrimp crepe was a bit plain, even with the lobster sauce, and needed more salt or lemon. La symphonie sweet crepe was simple and enjoyable with the fruit, powdered sugar, and maple syrup. However, the best crepe that I would order again would be the Neptune crepe, which had a lot of umami flavor going on with the shrimp, lobster, scallop, mushrooms, lobster sauce, and cheese. Waiter service was adequate. Could've been better with clearing plates and changing out the utensils between savory and dessert crepes, but it was nice that they were able to split the check with our large group and they did refill our waters and keep track of our orders for our group of twenty people or so. Overall, enjoyable experience. If you're looking for a creperie in Old Montreal, I recommend checking this place out.

Chez Suzette is located in Old Montreal, on a super cute street. If the weather allows for it, give yourself the time to wander around. Its really in a nice location. We came here based off a recommendation for the french onion soup. My husband and I really stopped by for some light eating, so went with a french onion soup, a corn chowder (I think that's what it was, it was a special) and the escargot.  The french onion soup was good but I was not blown away by it like I thought I was going to be. Maybe I set my expectations too high but I have had just as good french onion, if not better, back home. The broth of the soup was really good but still did not find it to be anything out of this world good. My husband enjoyed the corn chowder and I tasted it too. It had a smokey flavor, which we both like and it was super creamy. Our favorite take away from our visit to Chez Suzette was the escargot. It came prepared in an garlic butter sauce and this was both of our first times trying escargot and we LOVED it. So yummy, prepared so well and truly was enjoyable. The service here was bad, slow, we felt forgotten about and really had to hunt down the waiter for anything we needed, including the check. Maybe give this spot a try, maybe don't give it a try, I can go either way honestly. But if you do come, try the escargot.

My weakness! I am not a sweets person but crepes are definitely one of the exceptions. I always get a Nutella crepe with whipped cream and ice cream. The crepes here was so good and such a great portion unbelievably I couldn't even finish all 4. I paired it with a glass of champagne and it was the perfect way to fulfill my craving because I was not leaving Montréal without trying some authentic crepes!

Great crepes, both in variety and in taste. It was hard to even pick one to order!We came for dessert and luckily we had no wait to sit and were escorted upstairs. We went with the bananas and nutella crepes because that is a winning combination and it also included ice cream and whipped cream. It was delicious and sweet, but also a massive portion, so sharing one of these is a must. The coffee was also strong and paired great with the crepes, and the service was great. Honestly, after coming here I wish I had gotten a savory crepe too and maybe the fondue, but alas, there is only so much one can order at one occasion. I sort of stumbled upon this place without previously looking it up, and I was definitely pleasantly surprised.

This place is super cute and in Old Montreal.  If you are looking for a great french onion soup, this place is it.  They also have savory and sweet crepes.  The place is huge and there is a clean bathroom.  You won't have to worry about getting a table.  This place also takes cc.  This place isn't bad for a meal if you are in the area.  Food comes out quick, service is good, can't beat that.  One thing though is to pass on the sangia.  It's a bit watered down.

Chez Suzette was a super cute and tasty restaurant in old Montreal! It was my one and only crepe restaurant visit in Montreal and so I went with the ultimate crepe. It was totally loaded with seafood - expensive but worth it! It had giant shrimps, scallops, and quite a bit of lobster, baked with cheese. I frickin love seafood, and the crepe did not disappoint - the portion of seafood inside the crepe was piping hot, generous, and juicy! I also ordered a fancy boozy coffee - it was ok but not as boozy or strong as I would have preferred!Service and ambiance was great. We were on the main floor, right at the window with an adorable curtain. As the snow fell in old Montreal, it felt warm and cozy inside! Awesome place to try a crepe!

A solid choice in old Montreal to take a break from the cold and warm up with fondue, a crepe or a coffee. We stepped into the seemingly small restaurant and expected to wait for a table as most were already full. Little did we know, there are 2 other floors with lots of tables to choose from. The top floor was the sunniest, so we opted for a spot near the window.I ordered the ham and swiss crepe and my boyfriend had the chicken supreme. My crepe was average; there was lots of cheese but some of the ham got so hard that I couldn't eat it and there wasn't much flavour to the crepe. My boyfriend was happy with his choice, there was lots of filling and all the flavours went really well together.I'd come back to Chez Suzette - but would order something different from the menu.

Delicious crepes in a nice setting of old Montreal on a beautiful winter day with snow falling?  Yes, that was this experience was!  I ordered a delicious savory crepe called La Charlevoix which contained ham, Brie, & spinach in a Beschamel sauce.  It was delightful!  Then came a dessert to share for the table.  After negotiations, the decision was made for the La Rougemont crepe with Apples, cinnamon, almonds, & ice cream.  It certainly did not disappoint

Cute restaurant in Old Port! My boyfriend and I were looking for crepes and escargot and this checked both of them off. We were seated upstairs by the window, nice view and breeze especially on a nice summer day. Our server was friendly. The menu had a variety of crepes - sweet and savory. We ordered the Neptune - it came with a variety of seafood topped with a lobster sauce and cheese - and escargots. Those escargots hit the spot! I loved the garlic butter it was drenched in. The crepe was good but could've been better I just added the garlic oil on it for more flavor. I would come back but maybe order different crepes next time, maybe a sweet one!

We loved this place! Everyone had a smile, our server was helpful, quick and kind. Food was great!The béchamel sauce on our crepe, and the whole crepe in general, got cold pretty quickly and it was a bit bland, but otherwise good.Swiss fondue was amazing! We could have used a bit more cheese for the amount of dipping items. But who wouldn't want more cheese in life??? There is never enough cheese. My Viennese Coffee was tiny! Maybe I should have ordered a double for a real afternoon pick-me-up. But it was yummy.The streets were cold, wet and snowy that day and Chez Suzette was warm and welcoming. Thank you!!

Had crepes for lunch (forgot the names)...First one had ham, Swiss cheese, spinach and mushrooms with bechamel sauce. Second one had ham, Brie, caramelized onions with maple syrup.  Both were excellent choices for lunch. Big portions, could've been shared to leave some space for dessert.

If you're looking for a crepe place, this is it. They literally have all types you can think of - savoury or sweet, or both. This spot is very casual and great for a quick bite. We ended up visiting this place a couple of times when we visited Montreal a couple of weeks ago.Food came out pretty fast and the quality was pretty consistent. My boyfriend ended up getting the Nutella crepes both times. You get 4 crepes for $10! Super fresh, thin crepes, loaded with Nutella. For both times, I opted for a savoury crepe (forgot the name) with ham, swiss cheese and bechamel sauce. Loved the bechamel and the crepe was nice and warm. I also ordered the onion soup but was quite a letdown - super thin, flavourless, and the bread was quite burnt and gave the soup an undesirable taste.Service was pretty subpar for both visits, but the cheap, fresh and delicious crepes made up for it.

We stopped by for brunch and were seated immediately. There were a lot of choices, and the server was very patient with our questions. We ordered sangria, French onion soup and a variety of crepes. They were done very well. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area.

user_city: Central West End, St. Louis, MO
user_review: Located in the heart of the old port of Montreal, I find this place has some of the best (sweet AND savoury!) crepes. This time though I ended up going for the cheese fondue which did not disappoint. The cheese was plentiful as were the bread pieces and fruit.  Affordable and has a homey feel inside.

For my US based friends - Chez Suzette is like a diner.  You know how diners have such a diverse menu that you could spend 10 minutes reading and still not know what to get?  That is Chez Suzette.  They do them all well however the service on the night we visited was awfully slow and not very friendly.  They are a great spot if you're hungry in a pinch as they have a huge upstairs area for seating which you can't really see from the street.  enjoy!

I was in the mood for crepes of all types so I decided to give Chez a try. I started off with the Florentine as the main course. It was tasty but not "amazing" or "wow." However, it was satisfying as a meal. For dessert I had the Nutella with Strawberries Crepe. You can never go wrong with a dessert crepe. The crepe was airy, warm and paired perfectly with Nutella, berries, and ice cream. The staff were wonderful to speak with and our table was clean. The restaurant has two floors so it was large enough to satisfy the incoming customers. There was no wait at all. It's not the most amazing place for a crepe, however if I lived close by, it's worth stopping by.

Chez suzette was recommended to us by the hotel concierge for lunch and we were not disappointed.  It is cozy and inviting and the sandwiches are delicious and refreshing.  Wish I would have come back here to try some of the fondue.

Surprisingly one of the only cafes serving crêpes. At least from what a tourist can find. But we did look for awhile!The location is located on a cute street that looks most like Europe compared to all the other streets of Old Montréal so be sure to check it out! There are  a lot of other shops and dining spots on this street as well. There were plenty of choices for crêpes, both of savory and sweet kind. We went for lunch so we wanted a savory crêpe. In the end, we decided to go with the Mediterranean crêpe with came with ratatouille filling (veggies with a tomatoe base sauce) and chicken. At first I was hesitant to split one because the crêpes back at home are pretty thin but once our food came to our table I felt much better! The crêpes here are very large. Plenty of food for 2 people to share unless you are starving or you want to eat a heavy meal. For us, it was the perfect amount of food for a light lunch.We will definitely be back to try their sweet crêpes!
One of the best breakfast cafes in the Old Port. Love this place. Go back every trip. Treat yourself to a really wonderful dining experience here.  LOVE the fondues!

DON'T BE BAMBOOZLED BY THE STAR AVERAGE IT IS NOT YUMMY. There are only two options to why there are good reviews on the fondue. One: the cooks are inconsistent.Two: the yelp moms are crazy. I've never had fondue before so I don't know what's it suppose to be like. All I know is that I don't like it. The wine in the cheese was so strong it made everything bitter. I've never had alcohol before but I've gotta say it doesn't taste good and probably not good for children. The cheese wasn't hot enough so it didn't really stick. The bread was cold  and didn't taste fresh.The veggie plate was all raw which just felt weird to eat with cheese. Not sure if it's suppose to be like that. It was really gross to me. Even my parents though the alcohol was way to strong. I ended up just eating the grapes and the apples which were good.But, I did like the onion soup. it was sweet but not too sweet. Also I've never had escargot, so once again don't know what it's suppose to be like, but I liked it. Very buttery :)The quiche was average but, not pretty so I didn't take a photo of it. Basically looked like scrambled eggs in a square with a pile of lettuce next to it. I make much better and I'm 16.Listen to the real expert. Someone who has never had fondue in there life.Fondue? More like fonDON'T

Dropped by for a midday snack: cheese fondue! It was nice to try something different. The cheese cake with bread, apples, grapes, and olive bread. The cheese had a very strong white wine after taste, but overall was very tasty.

You will see another review of mine for Chez Suzette that is quite favorable. I have continued to go here once a year or so when I am in Montreal and Chez Suzette has slowly gone downhill, culminating in the most recent disaster. Service has gotten unacceptably slower last few visits. Perhaps this is because the last three times my party has been seated upstairs (which I never knew existed) and you might as well be in Siberia with the remoteness from attentive staff and lack of atmosphere. However this last weekend was the worst and we will not be coming back. In short, we were seated. Took ten minutes for a waiter to come by and offer coffee.  Another ten minutes to come back to take our order.  And then...we waited.  Nothing. Except all the people around us including some who came in 30 minutes after us were eating. But for us, NOTHING. After half an hour we flagged down the waiter for more coffee.  Ten minutes later (close to an hour of you do the math) still no crepe.  This is crepes folks, breakfast, should not take this long, right? After being told "three more minutes" and waiting five we got up and left. Offered to lay for our coffee and the waiter actually started to ring it up when my wife said  "the coffee wasn't even. That good" then he stopped and said we could go. Such a disappointment. There are other fine, similar, but better establishments on the same block. We will not be returning after 10 or so visits over six years. They hardly even cared. Tourist trap. Good news is we walked to the Old Port and had fabulous bacon and sausage poutine for breakfast!

Perfect choice for lunch on a cold day in Montreal. Warm and welcoming and service was fantastic! Swiss fondue was delicious...especially with the refill of bread. French onion soup was great as well. Kids had their favorite...escargot with cheese on top and some hot apple cider. Crepe dessert La Sonia was the perfect finish!!

Being adults, we gave ourselves permission to have desert for lunch, specifically Crepes Suzette, accompanied by a glass of cheap Italian Chardonnay. The crepes were good and the restaurant authentically charming. I don't have any basis to judge their ability to prepare a real meal, but it was just right for our splurge.
French onion soup excellent. Neptune crepe very good. Service friendly but slow. Definitely would return.

Happned to pass by while touring the old Montreal, boyfriend wanted to have some crepes. Crepe was good, ordered crepe with Apple, added chocolate. I have to rate 2 stars because from the moment I sat down, I didn't feel welcome and the service by Martin was not impressed. Very basic service with no smile, waited 10 minutes for the bill turns out he forgot about it. I really wanted to stay longer or go back to try their cheese fondue, but unfortunately I will never go back again.With the quality of service and the food, it is over priced with tips.

Nice place! A lot of choice of drinks and food!Be careful however, they dont have a bar license so you need to order food if you order alcoholic drink! Staff is very friendly.. would recommend the place

Was in the area and decided to come in to Chez Suzette. We were seated quickly and the staff were very friendly.For appetizers we ordered garlic bread and the buttered escargot which tasted very good and did not take very long to get to the table. We ordered crepes which took a very long time and they weren't that good. I ordered the Delice Special (crepe with ham, scrambled eggs, ham and Swiss cheese) and the eggs tasted like fast food scrambled eggs. I didn't finish my crepe and didn't take it home. Their menu has a few items to choose from so maybe I'll come back but I wouldn't order the crepes.

I only came here for dessert, but from what I can see they have a pretty complete meal/ dessert menu. The waiter was very friendly and the food came out very fast. I ordered the nutella banana crepe and it came out great (not that one can really ruin this classic). I would have to come back to try other items on the menu. I have to add that it is a bit pricy, but hey I guess it's the old port price.

I mean, the Cognac and Grand Marnier sauce on the crepes was good but the crepes themselves tasted pre-made.  Real fresh made crepes should be slightly crisp.  They were not.  These basically reminded me of IHOP crepes. Healthy portion sizes though.   I couldn't finish.

We loved coming to Suzette so much we came twice during our vacation in Montreal. The sweet and savory crepes were delicious. Nice, reasonable portions. The severs were all very kind and personable. The food was always hot and came out quick. The hardest part was picking which crepe to order out of all the options they have!
Casual and fast dining between tours on your way back to Notre Dame. French onion soup looks good but order the crepes here! Prices are reasonable.

I would make the five hours drive back to Montreal just to go to Chez Suzette. In fact, I visited here twice on my weekend trip to Montreal! The first time I came to this restaurant, it was a quiet morning and we were seated at a corner table by a window which was very cute and had a nice view of Rue St. Paul (pictured). I ordered a cappuccino which was good, and the La Campagnarde which was filled with Brie cheese, ham, and caramelized onions with a side of maple syrup (pictured). I was in HEAVEN and didn't want it to end! The second visit was a busy Saturday afternoon and we were seated upstairs. The atmosphere was definitely different and transformed from a quiet cafe to a busy restaurant. I wish I tried one of the many other crepes on the menu, but I ordered the La Campagnarde again and didn't regret it! My friend ordered the French onion soup which was equally amazing.I also found that the service was pretty decent, which I did not find at most other restaurants I visited in Montreal. Highly recommend Chez Suzette!

This happens to be my second visit and I left this place disappointed.My first visit was so delightful that I wanted to come dine here again but this time I wasn't blown with your food.My food as you can see in the photos was a Nutella crepe, seafood crepe and seafood coquille.I don't want to go in the details of the food but just want to mention that my food was cold??We were so hungry that didn't bother to send it back but I wish I would have done that.The seafood crepe had become overly salty since it was served cold.I wasn't quite able to distinguish the flavors of the main dishes since there weren't hot.Everything just tasted meh except for the Nutella crepe of course.Service here was great-our server was friendly and sweet.I did get a chance to use their bathroom and found them very clean.Their location is absolutely brilliant right in the middle of all the action.We didn't have to wait here since we got to the restaurant after the lunch rush.

I came here to treat myself to a nice meal. And I was not disappointed. I ordered the Chicken Pesto Sandwich ($10.99CAD) which came with a salad. The sandwich was really good, very tasty. I was full after eating it but I really wanted some crepe also. I ordered the Strawberry Nutella Crepe ($13.99CAD). The portion was big and very tasty. I came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. My total of the two meals came out to $28.72CAD after Canadian taxes. It was worth it! Another positive is the decor. I sat by the window on the second floor and had a good view of the streets of Montreal. The staffs were very friendly and attentive. One less star because it was very hot on the second floor. The third floor was a lot cooler.

I stayed in Montreal for a weekend and stopped in at Chez Suzette for breakfast before heading back to Toronto.  It was cold and snowy outside so I had start with the French onion soup.  I also had an amazing breakfast crepe!The onion soup was so good!  The thick layer of cheese on top looked and tasted great!  The soup was perfectly season and the onion wasn't overpowering like some onion soups are.Even though the onion soup was good, the crepe was even better!  The picture I attached doesn't do it justice because the inside was packed full of cheese, egg, ham, and bacon!  Each bite was full of each of these ingredients and the maple syrup topped it all off.This restaurant was amazing.  The food was to die for and the service was super friendly.  If I ever find myself in Montreal again I'm definitely going to be coming back for another delicious (and horribly filling) breakfast!

My friend and I were very much in the mood to try cheese fondue, but I wasn't sure if this was just a French stereotype and whether they would actually have cheese fondue in Montreal. I stumbled across this place on yelp, and it seemed like it had quite good reviews.We headed over to the restaurant and discovered that this place was very much a tourist hot spot and was located and decorated as such. The building of the restaurant is quite nice and historic and they have 3 floors with a nice view. We ordered the traditional Swiss cheese fondue and the montrealise crepe. The food arrived soon enough.The fondue came in a little ikea bucket and with a side of olive bread, green apples and purple grapes. The fondue was very disappointing. Way too much wine, and so it overpowered the flavor of the cheese itself. The apple and grapes in the cheese was surprisingly good with the cheese, but my friend and I found it difficult to eat the bread because of the winey cheese.The crepe was passable. Nothing special here.If you are looking for a more authentic or representative Montreal dinner experience, definitely go somewhere else.

Best escargot and French onion soup especially on a cold day. We even came back a second night just for the banana and Nutella crepe and it was packed then too. Super cozy atmosphere and they didn't scoff at us when my brother with special needs dined with us. We left each time happier than when we even arrived!

We dined here on the CAD$80 for 2 people fondue special.  It was your standard fare of a 3-course fondue meal.  We started with the Swiss cheese fondue with white wine and kirsh, then had the chicken and beef for the main course, followed by the chocolate fondue for dessert.The one complaint I would have is that this was an exceptionally long meal.  Although I was fully prepared for it to be a long meal, I don't think our table was waited on as thoroughly as I would've liked.  Nevertheless, the food was very good and the ambiance was quite charming.

Came here for breakfast after scrolling through Yelp. Was not disappointed. Ordered the chicken supreme and cheesecake crepe to share and was surprised at how well I enjoyed it. I loved the cheesecake crepe especially. The strawberries were sweet and crepes fluffy. However, I did not enjoy the coffee bowls as much as it tasted really thin and slightly burnt. Michel our server was great! Really friendly and efficient.

We were wandering through Vieux Montreal and craving fondue. Thanks to Yelp, we found out we were just a half mile from Chez Suzette! The friendly staff escorted us up to the 3rd floor dining room where we had a great view of the street below. Thankfully, we walked all morning and didn't feel terribly about indulging in the lobster bisque and French onion soup. Three of us had the Swiss fondue while one in our party went with a ratatouille crepe. The food was deliciously rich and cheesy and paired well with reasonably priced wine. It was a very enjoyable leisurely lunch!

My friend recommended this place to me strictly for their crepes. I was a bit hesitant when I saw the reviews, but I'm so glad I went!I came here in the morning during a stroll around Old Montreal. It was still early, so no crowd yet. We were seated right away at a cute corner table in the window with a view of Rue St Paul. They have a pretty big menu, but from my friend's recommendation I went straight for the crepe section. I ordered the La Campagnarde which is a savory crepe filled with ham, brie cheese, and caramelized onions. It's served with maple syrup, which you definitely want to drizzle on top. It was one of the most amazing breakfasts I've had. I still daydream about it.. I also ordered the cappuccino which really woke me up. Just to warn you, the large is LARGE. They are not joking when they call it a bowl of coffee, because it is so much that they serve it in a bowl. It was actually fun to drink and tasted great, but I couldn't finish mine since it was too big.Very friendly staff and quick service, which is good if you have a lot to see/do during your day like we did.If I had more time in the area I would've returned for another crepe during my stay. Not sure about their other menu items, but the crepes were delicious. Highly recommend it!

I will be honest here. The food was fantastic which deserves a five. But I will say that it smelled like stench in there. I'm not sure if the bathroom was broken or something but it smelled so bad my senses couldn't even adap to the smell overtime. This affected my overall experience to a four.

I dont know how to tell you ive been going to Chez Suzette for over 10 years and have yet to write a review :oIts been my traditon to visut everytime ive visited! Love their patio and prime old montreal location ^_^There are a few gems worth stopping in among the tourist traps and this is one i love!From their French onion soup, their escargots, crepes, chocolate or cheese fondues, sandwiches to their alcoholic concoctions!!!They also sell their wine with just a $5 mark up on price ^_^ honest and delicious!The service is always good no matter how busy they are!3 floors which is awesome and spacious.Lastly make a reservation on open table to skip the line!
Such good service and amazing crepes! Great menu too they have a wide variety of options. This place is very cute and aesthetically pleasing as wel

This was the first stop in our foodie road trip to Canada and New England. We were expecting quality service, a fun environment, and tasty food- we were not disappointed.Ambiance- Chez Suzette is located in the heart of an extremely busy area- the restaurant has multiple floors and can seat ALOT of people. It is a busy restaurant because of the busy area- a great feeling if you enjoy exciting night life. Service- very good! Quick to be seated- server came to us right away, and the food came out promptly. There was a point where our server accidentally knocked over an empty bottle in front of me, which startled me, but he felt so bad he gave me a complimentary beer! Great guy!Food- delicious! We ordered a medley of appetizers and our own entrees- we were not disappointed- food tasted fresh and made with care- my French onion soup was on the money! I ordered a chicken crepe- which was tender and juicy while the crepe was light and fluffy. My highlight of dinner was my white chocolate banana split milk shake.... it was so good I didn't even have a chance to take a picture! I just devoured it!Bathroom- yes very cleanStreet parking- don't even think about it! If you drive you will have to park in a garage or walk long distancesPrice- not bad- worth the money in my opinionLove it or dump itLove it- I recommend it

Tourist trap. Bad food, disorganized service. The waiters were nice but overwhelmed. French onion soup was so basic and served cold. Shrimp crepe with lobster sauce was gross and the more traditional crepes were tasteless. Shocked by all of the good reviews.
Best meal we have had since arriving in Montreal. Small quaint place and the service is great. We both had crepes and boy they were awesome. Highly recommended
French onion soup, quiche, staff ,service , fabulous. Every dish on every table looked delicious. Restaurant is very clean. A must stop for tourists and locals alike.

Crepes for breakfast, what a way to start the day!My husband ordered the Vegetarian Western Crepe came with scrambled egg, mushrooms and red peppers with Swiss cheese. He was so thrilled with his food he stopped talking just to savour the flavours. He also had cup of coffee which he said was smooth. The Traditional Crepe was goat cheese with honey and toasted almonds. I was literally doing a happy dance in my seat eating this. So totally amazing. Our friend ordered the Cheese Cake Crepe which was really delicious.

My last visit to this place was over a decade ago, and it was a very pleasant surprise to see that the food is still wonderful, and service is still offered with a smile. This is a great place for all ages, and one of the few places in Vieux Montreal, where it's easy to feed your kids, since the selection is quite large. Will repeat, many times.

This one of favorite places in Vieux Port, Montreal. We had cheese fondue and baked onion soup. Service was excellent and the prices are moderate. Not sure why anyone would give a lower rating. On our two visits it was wonderful.

Had a very good bowl of French Onion soup with yummy cheese melted on top. Lots of onion and not too salty as many bowls of french onion soup tend to be. Was the perfect cozy spot on a cool, cloudy day in the heart of Old Town in Montreal. The window seat was the ideal place to watch the world pass by. The supreme crepe with egg, bacon, ham, Swiss cheese, and mushroom was yummy too. The real maple syrup served with the crepe was a nice compliment to the perfectly cooked, thin crepe. This is a very good mid-day spot.
The place is great. The Swiss fondue is the best. Top it off with some hot chocolate on a cold day.

This place was pretty good. The outside is deceiving though because it looks small up close but it is massive on the inside! So don't expect to get a quick lunch here on the weekend. The cheese fondue was nice. We got the herbs, spices, and dried tomato fondue which was ok. We enjoyed it more with the fruit and not so much with the bread. The bread had dried olives in it or something that gave it a bitter taste. We also ordered a BLT which was fresh, hot, and tasty. I just wish the wait hadn't been so long because we had a lot of sightseeing we wanted to do.
On a chilly winter day, this was just the place to seek shelter. Scrumptious crêpes (savory and sweet), tasty beverages, and an affordable menu! Definitely a spot to come back to

Another favorite of mine whenever I come and visit Montreal. I've been coming here since 2011 and a must get when coming here is their Toffee Crepe with Ice Cream plus their Escargot and French Onion Soup. If your ever in Old Montreal, drop on by. You won't regret it.

Discrimination at its finest. It is difficult enough to navigate this area with a child in a wheelchair and this restaurant seemed like they would have preferred to tell us they couldn't accommodate us. First they offered us a table upstairs (there are no elevators in this area). Then they shoved the 5 of us at a table for 4 and brought over 4 waters. They told my 5 year old to sit at the end so he wouldn't block the area as much as the rest of us. Unfortunately we didn't get to try any of the food and most certainly won't attempt it again. Thanks for making our lives even more difficult than they already are.

This was a great place! Vann,our waiter, advised us on the French onion soup- sooo goood! We chose twoCrepes instead of the fondue and that was a great decision! (Very filling but not as heavy as cheese and bread!)This was our first dinner in old MontréalAnd the perfect place! No regrets!

I must admit, I didn't get the crepes here. Instead, I got a fulfilling meal of fondue, both swiss and chinoise. That was plentiful for 2 people, I can't imagine how full my tummy would be if I also got the chocolate fondue.The cheese fondue was excellent -- creamy and savory, served with the usual bread cubes and fruits. The broth fondue was good too! It looked very plain when it was served -- with a plate of meats and a plate of typical vegetables (mushrooms, broccoli, etc), but the actual beef broth was mouthlickingly delicious! So unassuming, yet so yummy.They also have a few affordable wines, which go well with the delicious meal. Service is a bit sparse (well, not quite saccharin like south of the border anyway), but it's sufficient, and in line with other places around here, if only a little bit slow.

every time i'm in montreal, i come here for a crepe. i'm half french, so it's hard to impress me, but i really like this place's food. the portions are decently sized, and the desserts are delicious. it's a tourist-y spot, but it's a good one.unfortunately, when i went there last night, there was a foul smell that filled the whole cafe. i don't know if someone got sick, or someone tracked in dog poop, but it was disgusting and i had to leave immediately.still, i reccommend this place to anyone who wants a yummy and decently priced crepe. the smell was most likely just bad luck on my part. i haven't had a problem the other times i've been there and thoroughly enjoy myself.

This place is much much larger than it seems.  Highly recommend making a reservation in advance!  The crepes were delicious!  I had Brie in mine and it was melted perfectly.  The portion size was large.  The crepe was also the perfect thickness and cooked just right.  It wasn't soggy and it wasn't burnt to a crisp.Highly recommend if you're in old Montreal!

Our waiter made it seem like we were inconvenient to take up his time, while the place was nearly empty. Ordered the Charlevoix crepe and were disappointed in the sauce and the crepe itself. We visited Jardin Nelson twice and would recommend that as a crepe destination over this place for service alone.

The crepes for dessert were really good. The service on a Saturday night was surprisingly efficient given that our waiter had way too many tables. The meat fondue was more than adequate. But the big disappointments - the wine list sucks (8 or 10 choices each for red and white and totally generic - think 7-11 wine choices) and most of all, don't try to pass off the fondue as gruyere! Maybe there is some in the mix... but it is mostly white cheddar or something equally mediocre. I am Swiss - I would never, ever order a cheddar fondue. If that is what you are going to serve, fine - but be honest about it so that those of us who know something about what a real gruyere fondue tastes like can chose something different rather than be disappointed. Not to mention that we had to send both (we were 4 adults so ordered 2) back at first because they were barely warm, let alone hot like fondue should be. And, the bread was weirdly cold. On the flip side, the chocolate fondue was a hit, especially with the pre-teens in our group.

Since we were in Montreal my wife wanted to try their crepes so we decided to go to this place based on reviews I had read.We went for lunch and place was kind of packed so that created a good vibe and asked for a menuMy wife was going to order a crepe obviously but since I do not eat eggs I ordered a roasted veggie sandwich Food - Crepe was good but nothing special / extraordinary and did not blow her as anything great. My sandwich was ok and could be better. For any add'l items , roasted veggies I added, they charged me extra but had not told me it would be extra. Service - ok staff was helpful and friendlyAmbience - ok nothing spectacular . I think they have 2 -3 floorsOverall an OK experience but not place that I would go again too as nothing really memorized us.
Small quaint place but the food is beautifully delicious! Definitely worth it! I would recommend it others.

What's better for breakfast on your last day in Montreal than crepes?  Glad you agree.  Just down the street from our hotel was Creperie Suzzette with a sidewalk café.  Perfect!Two cups of coffee ($4.98), La Speciale Delice ($14.99) stuffed with scrambled eggs, ham, bacon, Swiss cheese, and mushrooms, and La Parisienne ($13.99) stuffed with Brie cheese and fresh apples.  What a nice sendoff this turned out to be.Portions were very generous and each of our crepes came with real maple syrup.  Service was very good considering they got slammed as soon as they opened.  Fortunately for us, we arrived just as the kitchen was catching up with the initial rush.  The crepes may have been a bit tough, but the flavor and fillings made up for that.

A delicious find in Ville Marie!! Excellent for brunch, lunch, dinner, and dessert!! Food and service were top-notch in a relaxed setting. It feels as though you are eating in your Mémère's kitchen!!I enjoyed their quiche lorraine- light and fluffy single-serving quiche (not cut from a larger pie- instead made just for one). I subbed in the onion soup instead of the greens--- TOTALLY worth the $4 suppl. charge. My friend got the brie sandwich with the caramelized inions ... YUMMM!!! Served warm on a toasty baguette-- perfect for a chilly winter's day.We were pleasantly surprised when our FANTASTIC server brought us a FREE strawberry shortcake milkshake!! It looked amazing and tasted even better!!Merci beaucoup, Chez Suzette!

In a street full of tourist-trap restaurants, this one stands out simply because they make some solid crepes and soups.I was expecting the crepes to be decent and this place didn't disappoint.  The vegetable crepe was really well made and the portions were pretty sizeable.  I also tried the montreal salmon bagel and it was a pretty good sandwich.  Very simple but the salmon was really tasty.  What surprised me about this place was how good their French Onion soup was.  The cheese was perfectly baked and the soup was just right.  Not too salty and not too onion-ny.  I was very pleased with the meal as a whole.The place gets pretty packed during peak hours and you may expect to wait a while, but they have a lot of seating upstairs as well.

On a day trip to Old Montreal, we were looking for a quaint little place for a casual lunch and this place fit exactly what we were looking for! Fondue, crepes, salads, soups, sandwiches and desserts did not disappoint. Our server was very sweet and efficient.  The bruschetta appetizer was very different in that the diced tomatoes and onions were served in a ramekin with shaved cheese on top with two spoons and toasted crostini on the side. It was very yummy as was the french onion soup, brie and carmelized onion panini and the seafood crepe with. Bechamel sauce was lovely. We were so full by lunch that we skipped dessert but we will be back. That fondue at the next table was very tempting. Pricing is what you'd expect for a touristy section of the city, but it was a very pleasant experience!
Cute lil French diner feel with good food and clean bathrooms, right behind Notre dame basilica. What more could you ask for?! We will be back

[Montreal Food Tour Stop #6] Big crepes, savory and sweet, along with other breakfast food in a hopping part of Old Montreal.  There's an upstairs and downstairs dining room in this restaurant.  On a nice day, the windows will be open for fresh air.Highlights: Large, tasty crepes.  I ordered Crepe La Sonia, which is a large dessert crepe that includes strawberries, bananas, and hot chocolate sauce.  As a bonus, there's vanilla ice cream served on the side.  The crepe looked great and was sprinkled with powdered sugar.  There was a lot of fruit on the inside and the crepe itself was fluffy.  Yummy and sweet, but not too sweet.Critiques: The bananas in the crepe were a little overripe.  The crepe was big and very good, but it was a little expensive ($13-14 CAD) for a crepe of this quality.  I was probably paying a little more for the atmosphere.Overall: Solid crepes in a popular touristy part of town.  The flavor was very good overall.

My crawl through Old Montreal eateries continued in here when the family decided crepes and fondue were the ticket for dinner.  Located on the corner on Rue St. Paul, it's in a prime spot.  The menu consists mostly of a variety of sweet and savory crepes, sandwiches, quiches, salads and fondues.  The cheese fondue was good and they gave plenty of bread to dip.  My only critique would be that they were a bit heavy with the white wine but that's a personal preference.  The smoked salmon salad was good with a nice amount of smoked salmon.  The crepes were also good but they were a bit heavy on the béchamel and cheese for my liking.  All in all a good bite but kind of expensive (which is to be expected here).  Solid 3.5 stars.

I ordered the crepes for dessert and they were cold and thick in texture. The ice cream served with it was gummy, horrible texture. The toffee cream and sliced almonds were good. The group I was with ordered the crepes Suzette and it tasted like orange cough syrup and again the crepes were cold.

This is a cute place. We ordered a bruschetta and fondue. The food was nothing to write home about. The bruschetta was particularly bad. The fondue was ok, we've definitely had better fondues. What annoyed us was the bread and the fruit platter that we had to dip. The bread was stale and the fruit was extremely raw. Definitely recommend skipping unless you don't have other options.

This place is amazing. If in the Old Port section it's a must. The food is delicious. Even though it gets pretty busy, the service is great. Great cocktails. The only drawback was that I couldn't keep my eyes from wondering to the other tables. Just checking out the beautiful food.

If I didn't give this place a 5, my family would obliterate me. They loved it. My daughter got the chocolate fondue. My wife and I got ratatouille with chicken crepes. There was a LOT of chicken. Dessert was also crazy good. I would tell anyone to put this on their list of places.
Delicious!!Service was great.  Coffee was excellent, the crepes delicious.My husband had the French onion soup and raved about it.
Nice service, fresh salad but just lettuce and a tomato slice. Savory crepes good but not much filling. Chocolate crepe a bit disappointing. Just a little chocolate sauce poured on.

This place is bigger than it looks. The service was ok, but we has to wait for about 10 minutes to  be greeted and order drinks, so we just ordered everything at once.I got an asparagus crepe that was bland and gloppy. How does a dish with cheese and bechamel have a dry mouth feel? Overall, a pass next time.

Although, this was a cute place right outside of Place Jacques-Cartier with outdoor seating, the food was bland and lack of wow factor.   Would have loved to see more flavor and creativity with their food.  I'd assume there's other places that's more worth wild to try.
One of my favorite restaurants in MontrealGreat service by Olivier and tasty fondue. I've been there a couple of times and the food is always top quality

Suggested to us by a friend that had gone just a few days ago, we stopped by for a quick lunch after the glowing review he gave.  We each got a soup (French onion and soup of the day) and then shared the Chicken Supreme crepe.  The soups were hot and yummy like any regular soup.  However, the crepe was extremely flavourless and clearly the chicken came from frozen since it had the pre-made grilled marks which I hate.  The menu states it is juicy and tender chicken, not rubbery and thawed...   We did not finish as we couldn't be bothered and then still left hungry.  Perhaps it would have been better if we ordered a sweet crepe?

I heard about the famous onion soup from Suzette and I was also drawn by this French bistro because I visited France two years ago. I was disappointed by the quality and service since the food was quite plain and overpriced, same for the sangria that we ordered. We sat on the terrace and had a good time talking, but the food (salmon salad and onion soup) and the drink were below average. Yet, since the restaurant is located at the intersection of St-Laurent and St-Paul, many tourists are willing to pay ridiculous amount to eat at this place, but honestly there are much better options for the same price around the same area.

We found this place while strolling through Vieux-Port Montréal. It was a much needed resting spot for us, and so quaint. The French onion soup was fantastic, and so were the pesto chicken paninis. My husband got the brie, apples and ham panini and like it too. We came back a second day, and I repeated my first lunch while my husband got the ham and spinach crepe. The chocolate fondu looked amazing too.

Walking through the beautiful streets of Old Montreal we stumbled across this homey mom and pop sort of resto. It was a bit chilly out so when we saw french onion soup we jumped. Food was hot, quick, and reasonbly price. Would def. go again

We walked in without reservation and waited just a few minutes for a table. We had the baked french onion soup which was out of this world! Then I had the warm chevre salad with apples and pecans, which was equally great. The cheese was brie and melted onto wedges of fresh bread. Hubs had a crepe with Swiss, spinach and mushrooms. And I had a taste...ymmm! I spied chocolate fondue on the menu but after lunch was too full to order more.  The food was so wonderful and typical french. The people watching from a corner table was entertaining as well.

Chez Suzette is a great spot in Old Montreal! It is just a 3-4 min walk from the Basilica making it very central. They have reasonably prices dishes and a variety of both sweet & savory crepes. This place is welcoming and has a lot to offer (including cheap sangria!!). It's also great for those traveling solo!

The crepes were good. Hubbie and I ordered the ratatouille crepe. Flavor was good but needed cheese. The French onion was disappointing though. The soup was cold and the cheese was not properly layered causing a big clump of unmelted cheese on top of the bread. Our server was really nice about it and did re-warm my soup and offered us a free drink. All and all, the experience was good. Tip: Call ahead of time to secure a table. Skip the cheese on the escargot.
Cute creperie in Old Montreal! Amazing crepe combinations savory or sweet you can't go wrong! they also have delicious fondue!!

My husband and I visited Chez Suzette this afternoon for lunch while visiting Old Montreal. It was a lovely, cozy spot for lunch and a coffee. We were both especially impressed by the mixed drinks they offered. I ordered a alcoholic coffee and my husband ordered a spiced rum cider, both delicious and perfect for a cool autumn afternoon. For lunch I ordered the Montreal Salmon and aBowl of lobster bisque. Both good, but the bisque is not to be missed, rich and creamy with large chunks of lobster. Yum! My husband ordered the chicken and Brie panini... also delicious. The pesto was the finishing touch on that. We will definitely return on our next trip through!
Always a pleasure to come here for crepes, coffee and a great view from upstairs. They also have a wonderful fondue selection.

Cute little diner in the heart of old Montreal. We made reservations and sat outside. It was a nice area of town and good people watching. We ordered cheese fondue- delicious - with bread fruits and veggies. We also ordered and ham and cheese crepe with bechamel sauce- YUM, and we ordered escargot covered sigh cheese and garlic. Legit!  It was like a trip to France! And we ordered a bottle of Chardonnay! Super delicious, intimate meal on one of the oldest streets in Montreal! Would highly suggest making reservations and sitting outside. We were happy with all of our food selections !

This restaurant lacked air conditioning on one of the hottest days of the summer. Aside from that, very nice experience. This place was on my list to visit when in Old Port Montreal. Did not disappoint, their savoury crepes do not cheap out on the quality, 10/10. I wish we could have had a second crepe for dessert but we just didn't have time. Can't go wrong coming here!
Crepes were good (but I've had better at home in BC), service was good but the restaurant was VERY LOUD which definitely took away from our dining experience.
In Old Montreal for New Years and just happened to stumble upon this cute place. Food was delicious! Escargots, French onion soup, crepes. Highly recommend!
The best crepes in Old Montreal!! Their menu has a great selection of both savory and sweet crepes. The Viennese coffee was also delicious.

An okay crepe place in the middle of Old Montreal. Really cute place. I had thought they were a bit too cozy until I realized there were three whole levels to the restaurant.The Quebec maple syrup fruit "Suzette Crepe" we ordered was good but nothing too special. The lobster bisque with cognac was fine but portion wise, for around $10, was way too small - also had maybe 3 small chunks of lobster.Service was top notch though.
We had the cheese fondue with sundries tomato, wine, and herbs. Great prices and cheese fondue was great--- except that it cooled a little quickly. Fun find off of St. Paul St.

Amazing place! The best crepe I've ever had! And also the best sangria as well! Price is fair, service is very good!  Remember to make a reservation in advance! The place is in Old Montreal, which is very cute and pleasant to visit!

Tourist trap ! I found the service cordial, and the French onion soup heart warming and tasty ! Then you'd ask what was wrong ? My Forstiere Crep was made with canned mushrooms, and it had a piece of "sliced cheese" on top ... which would be details if it did not taste as bland as the description. Very disappointing !
Came here for dessert. Had a crepe and pitcher of sangaria. Both were delicous, and staff were very friendly.Restaurant was large with 3 floors.

Let's just say I was craving crêpes. I selected the Délicieuse, $14, which was loaded with bananas, topped with sliced almonds and a toffee cream sauce, with ice cream on the side. Good balance of flavours and crêpe-to-accompaniments ratio. The crêpe itself was the perfect thickness.The Café Viennois (Viennese coffee) was satisfactory while the Chocolat Chaud was rich and above average. Both were $5.The décor is outdated and I can understand the lukewarm reviews. Although I wouldn't specifically come here, this quaint little café is a nice option to pop into when walking around Old Montréal.

Ah Old Montreal.. the European charm, the cobble stone street, the tourist traps... Yeah, this place has decent food for higher than average prices, but it makes up for it with comfortable outdoor seating, or multiple levels inside with nice cool AC for those muggy Montreal summers. Ordered a bottle of San Pellegrino with lemon for the glasses and we enjoyed a lunch of savory crepes - specifically the spinach, ham and brie filled one and a brie with caramelized onion sandwich. The sandwich came with a nice little side salad. Everything was tasty. Service was friendly, but leisurely which is fine when you are vacation. I wouldn't recommend this place as a destination, but if you are in the area looking to people watch with your meal this place fits the bill nicely directly on Rue Saint-Paul Est.
Great food, specially the crepes... clean and well maintained place. The French onion soup is also pretty good; we eat the supreme poulet crepe and the special delice... pretty good both of them

Chez Suzette is conveniently located in the heart of Vieux Montreal. Its outdoor seating as well as the second floor tables offer scenic views of tourists walking along Rue Saint Paul. When I visited, the wifi was broken, which was a bummer as wifi is super useful for a tourist visiting another country. The crepe itself was good but nothing particularly special. It was surprisingly filling and left my stomach with little space for dessert. The fondue options looked quite good based on what I saw from the tables around me, but if you're in the mood for simple crepe with a nice view then this is your dinner place
amazing baked french onion soup!! i would love to go back for more. the staff were very nice and welcoming.

We are not in the habit of complaining BUT this is quite simply a truly terrible crepe place. The reason is very simple: they pre-cook all their crepes in the morning and then they microwave them before serving, the result is a disaster. The crepe is not fresh of course, the texture is terrible, hot in some spots and cold in others. Becuase it is cooked hours before and microwaved the ingredients inside the crepe fight with each other.  We give them 5 stars for honesty: when asked they admitted that they pre-cook their crepes. We know crepes and this is absolutely NOT how a crepe is supposed to be enjoyed. Definitely a tourist trap because of its lovely location in the heart of Old Montreal.

My fiancé and I wandered into this restaurant while exploring the Old City, and luck was on our side! Beautiful place with tables overlooking Rue Saint Paul (would suggest getting a window table if possible).  I got the brie and leek quiche, which was recommended to me by our server, and it was fantastic.Overall an excellent experience, and I don't think I would change a thing.

Went for brunchSmoked salmon was amazing. The side salad that came with it was so good. The dressing was delicious. The ham and cheese sandwich was awesome and the French onion soup was DELICOUS.Would like to return to try crepes and some of the warmCocktails. The mulled wine especially caught my eye.

Having been to Paris it's not the best I ever had but I enjoyed the crepes (more out of hunger than flavor) and experience. Big portion but pretty expensive for what you get ($124 CAD for 4 with tip). Chocolate fondue was good for dessert. Attentive and friendly staff. No real ambience. Good for kids. They enjoyed it well enough.

Kind of a nothing place. Unexceptional. Somewhat shabby interior. It's in a very touristy area in Old Montreal. We wandered in, wanting a small snack. Ordered a small Nutella crepe. The waitress was all "that's the kid's portion". We fumbled, uncharacteristically, and said "Oh, okay" and ordered the "adult" size. MISTAKE. What we got was overwhelmingly sweet, with ice cream, and ugh, just TOO MUCH. I wouldn't go back here, it just wasn't that special.

I understand that lots of places like to seat people next to the window because it makes the restaurant look full. But when your windows don't have curtains and the sun is shining in right on the table, you probably shouldn't do that. That's what happened to us, and we probably should've moved, but I thought the sun would feel good. It did for the first 5 minutes, but I was sweating by the end. Why don't they have curtains? Strange.Our food was decent, I had the club sandwich and upgraded to a Caesar salad for $1.50. The salad was great, the sandwich was OK, but the bacon wasn't crispy and I think the chicken was the canned type. The bread was toasted so much that it actually hurt my mouth when I bit into it. On the upside, the service was very good.

This lovely little French restaurant is located in the heart of Old Montreal. It was 3 minute walk from Notre-Dame-de-Bon-Secours Chapel, the oldest Church in Old Montreal. Since I was craving for crepes, my husband and I decided to try this restaurant after we visited that church. The restaurant was not fancy and the furniture was old-fashioned. Since we were Asians, the servers did not put a lot of attentions to us (we had an impression that the servers didn't like Asians since they just spend time talking to either locals or Caucasians.) We ordered a Crepe Suzette (crepe served with a delicious orange sauce, Grand Marnier and Cognac), a French onion soup and a mocha. We were surprised the portion was very big in terms of the money we spent. That was probably the best crepe we have ever tried. I am always afraid of food with strong orange scent (since it reminds me of the smell of garbage chute for some reason), but here, the crepe was just perfect, you can taste the hint of orange flavor but it won't be too over. The crepes are very crispy, thin and chewy. The French Onion soup was full of cheese and hearty. The mocha works perfectly with the crepes. Aside from the service we had here, everything else was perfect! We will definitely come back to visit Chez Suzette! :)
Cant miss. Nestled in the old Montreal district, this is a great stop out of the cold. Warm up with the Crepe Suzette, the best crepe on the menu.Highly recommended

Great place to grab a crepe in Old Montreal. The hot chocolate was amazing and I really enjoyed my crepe. Nothing like a strawberry, banana and chocolate crepe for breakfast (La Sonia Crepe). I think the best thing about the restaurant is the ability to sit outside at a bistro table and people watch.

So we were caught in the rain and museums were closed because of the strike. Wandering upon this spot in Vieux Montréal was a treat.My wife got the crêpe s'more while I got the escargot au beurre d'ail (with cheese). Food was delicious. Would like to come back for the fondue, but everything looks amazing. Also got a few cocktails, they were delicious as well.Service was prompt and server was very pleasant. I was able to practice a little of my French (much appreciated). I would recommend anyone visiting to pay a visit. This establishment has multiple levels, plenty of space, clean and fresh, and plenty of simple European charm without breaking the bank.

I visited Montreal with my parents and took them to Chez Suzette. We got the 3 fondue combo that was a perfect meal that was very filling and totally worth the price. Whether you're looking for a quick bite to eat or there to enjoy a 3 hour long 3 course meal, Chez Suzette is a quaint place in Old Montreal that's worth a stop.

Excellent crepes!  They were one of the only places open on a Saturday morning while we were out walking Old Montreal and I'm so glad we decided to eat here. The food was delicious and the prices were great for the area.

Suzette's was a pleasant place to stop for lunch. Small upon entering, we were shown upstairs to another room. The tables are situated very close together and I felt I was on top of the table of girls next to me. Kathleen was our server and was friendly and provided good service.  I ordered the warm goat cheese salad, which was mixed greens, lots of apple slices, carrots and candied pecans with four crostini with warm goat cheese on top.  Large in size, this salad was tasty. My husband had a thin crepe filled with asparagus, ham and cheese. The food was decent, but didn't wow me.  Service was good, and the staff we encountered friendly.

This was for sure my most memorable dining experience of the entire trip to Montreal. Their Crepes Suzette were such a delectable highlight. The soft velvety orange sauce over tender perfectly executed crepes - YUM! Service was quite attentive, helpful, and friendly. Now, our waiter did say, "Large Breakfast?" when I ordered the crepes. I'm used to much smaller portions at home - but we managed to get within licking distance on that plate and finished them no problem. Don't pass this place up for great crepes.

My trip to Montreal fell on Canada day unexpectedly and we could not find many places that were open. We were checking out old Montreal and we were starving. Chez Suzette looked like the best option for crepes so we stopped by for brunch. They have 3 stories of seating. The hostess was not helpful at all when I told her we would like a table with a view. She sat us in the middle and we had to ask someone else to move to the table by the window. The view from our table was pretty nice. It took forever for our waiter to show up which was too bad because I was thirsty and just wanted water. The price of a simple crepe was off-putting so we got one to share. What stood out to us was the smores crepe. We asked the waiter if we could get it with bananas rather than marshmallows as we were allergic. He said no problem. Not once did he say that there would be a charge to substitute. Our smores crepe was tasty but very small for the high price they charged. When we got our bill we were outraged to see it cost over $20. Are you kidding me?! For a stingy crepe! What made me very mad was they charged us $2 for a few slices of bananas. We asked the waiter and he said there is nothing he can do about it. The crepe was good but no way worth the price. We wanted to try the fondue but it did not look like it would be worth the cost. Next time we will save our calories and go to the much superior cacao 70.

Such a lovely spot in the heart of Old Montreal!After my first visit back in 2011, I was in love. And made effort to go back there a couple more times since. I've had a couple of the dessert crepes, and one savoury. I can't recall which ones, but everything was fresh and delicious. The service was always good, and the ambiance is just lovely. Especially when it's warm and the windows are open.

We stopped here for the name sake Crepe Suzette.  It's been 30 years since I've enjoyed this marvelous desert crepe, and I was brought to tears with this restaurant's rendition.  The perfect crepe light and airy with the most delectable butter orange sauce.  I felt like I melted away with each mouthful.The wait staff was quite engaging and the atmosphere was just like a small cafe in Paris.  A wonderful experience four our last night in Montreal.

Me and my friend were in Montreal for a one day trip. We were walking on the street of Old port and saw this place that has cheese fondue! I have been wanting to try cheese fondue for a long time so we decided to have something small here. The atmosphere is cozy and quiet. The waitress is super friendly! We ordered French Onion soup and a Swiss fondue with white wine and kirsh. The soup is nice and has a sweet and rich flavour (what can go wrong with a French onion soup?) Personally, I like the fondue! My friend think the wine flavour is a bit strong and bitter, so maybe a little bit less wine flavour would be nicer? The waitress even asked us if we wants more bread! If we ever come back to Montreal, we would probably come back to try some other thing on the menu!

I had the lobster bisque which was just okay. It was a bit bland for my taste but was decent. I also had a dessert crepe...I don't remember the name but it was pretty good. It had bananas, almonds, and was served with ice cream. Service was also good. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. If you're walking around Old Montreal and want a quick bite, pop in and get a crepe! *tip: free wifi!

At first, I was looking at getting dessert crepes but I think the selection wasn't that good so I just decided to order a savory one. The crepe I got came with ham, swiss cheese and caramelized onions. I was actually looking to get something with gruyere cheese but most of what they offer only includes swiss cheese. I don't think the crepe itself was anything special. I was not impressed at all with my food. I also think it was too expensive for a crepe.

Cute creperie in old Montreal. I didn't know what to expect given that the restaurant was right in the most touristy part of town. However, the ham and cheese crepe I ordered was very good. Our table also ordered a quiche lorraine and the dish was also good. The serving was huge for the price and service was pretty fast. Definitely would recommend to anyone in the area.
Fantastic crèpes - highly recommend. Great service as well. Highly recommend! Big variety of things to chose from, and the coffee was good

The food here was fantastic and the service was a bit sub par because it was slow. Definitely try the fondue if you come here because it's awesome. Although the service was pretty slow, the wait-staff was super friendly and nice. If you're willing to spend a bit of time for good food, it's definitely worth the wait!!

Over priced compared to other really good restaurants in the area with beautiful decor and the food here is very shitty with no flavor what so ever.I stayed in Montreal for almost 2 weeks and this was the most disappointing brunch my family and I had here right before concluding 2017. There are soooo many other good restaurants to choose from in the area, so please skip this place. I can't believe it even has 3 1/2 stars. The only reason we went there was because most restaurants were closed on New Years Eve and didn't have an option for brunch and this was the only place open that was walking distance.The decor and food does not live up to the over priced crepes and fondue.
Fondue only review: Whatever you do, stay away from the fondue here...worse supermarket mix I have tasted in a long time. I hope other foods here are better. Service was pleasant.

This was an amazing late afternoon Crepe stop while we are in town. Great service and super quick. Really cute location. The server was so sweet and attentive. We got a Nutella and banana crepe and a le remy hot drink. The Crepe was huge perfect for two people. Super Lux and wonderful.
Excellent location in Vieux-Montréal; very welcoming to tourists. Three levels and many available window tables. I ate alone and had a very nice server; wished I had been with friends to taste more!

Do not come here for fondue. It's advertised as a fondue restaurant but it was not good.Waitress was friendly but so slow considering half the resto was empty when we arrived.They didn't even use fondue pots. They used a camping stove and an old pot.The skewers were all melted.The sauces were more like salad dressing than fondue sauce.The chicken was hardly cut so the peices were too large to cook quickly and even then we werent sure if it was cooked well.And more importantly it was $50 a person. The best fondue spots in Montreal don't charge this much.

Lovely Lunch spot! Service was great. The waitress told me upfront that the kitchen was a bit backed up - so I told her to bring my milkshake out and the crepe could wait. She did just that.The milkshake was great and the primavera crepe could have used some love on the eggplant in the ratatouille. But good place overall!

This place has the best breakfast I have ever had anywhere, and that's saying a lot because I've also been to France. I highly highly recommend this place. Even our Japanese guests were ecstatic with the food especially with the French Onion soup and smoked salmon crepes. In addition, we tried the Spinach quiche and the seafood croquille - everything was simply superb!This place surprisingly has three floors and can accommodate a lot of customers, with the restroom in the third floor. It has a nice, bright, and very clean atmosphere that balances very well the relaxed French casual vibe.We're definitely coming back for more, today in fact, our group simply couldn't resist for more!
Awesome food. Awesome service! Crepes were soft but well cooked. The vegetables were al dente - just the way I like them. The sauce was amazing! All in all a great experience
Very friendly service. I ordered the first fondue which was very alcoholic and not to my satisfaction. The crepes are not to my taste. I would come back to try desserts.
Food was ok nothing special and kind of pricey for what you get. Make sure if you go with kids to tell them you are ordering from kids menu.
The food was not salty. The service was super friendly. The place was clean and spacious. It's a great place for families. The menus are in French and English.

A walk along the cobblestone streets of old Montreal leads you to chez Suzette. Don't be fooled by the small first floor as there are two other seating areas upstairs. There are a variety of sweet and savory crepes to choose from, as well as  cappuccinos and gourmet espressos. As we were there for breakfast, hubby and I opted for savory crepes: ha, and cheese and bacon, eggs and cheese, both Ethan maple syrup. Would definitely return and try some of the sweet crepes for dessert.
Visited for breakfast on a quiet Sunday morning. The crêpes were ok, a bit chewy. Not sure I'd return.

While visiting Montreal, my daughter insisted we had crepes for one of our meals. The hostess was wonderful, but when we were sat at our table, I questioned our choice of venue. It lacked a charm to which we are accustomed in Montreal. The food wasn't up to par--crepes Lorraine arrived lukewarm with the béchamel sauce congealed and the cheese hardened. My daughter enjoyed the dessert crepes of Nutella and banana.  While the food was mediocre, our waiter was downright rude and made our experience most unpleasant.

No. Good for people watching but then so is every other tourist trap in Old Montréal (lovely area). Crepes, a French triumph, were not blessed by Bonaparte here. Though the beer (La Fin du Monde, a triple ale) and pleasant service put a festive wig on the occasion, it was not enough to rescue the Crepe aux Crevettes from drowning in lobster sauce, buried under a veritable mountain of matted cheese curds. The Cesar salad, unfit for an emperor, was sadly the best course of an otherwise ghastly meal. Topping off this French disaster was a blood-curdling cover of 'Here Comes the Sun' on the overhead, a taunting reminder of the fact that bad meals are often avoidable. Save your coin, and your stomach a trip to the loo.

Nice location, lovely place well furnished.The staff is very fast and gentle.The food is good and well cooked. The crepes are tasty and big, I took a bagel too and it comes with a side sale with a lovely dressing.As dessert of course I took a sweet crepe. It was Huge, served with ice cream, Delicious!The prices are slightly higher than the average but it's because the restaurant is located in the middle of the old town.If you can grab a sit on the outside of the place you'll be able to enjoy the view of the main street in the old town.
Delicious food. Patio is nice for people watching.  Ask for the sunny room upstairs if you eat inside. It's cheerful.  Good service. Prices good
nice enviroment and quick service. ordered two crepes and chocolate fundae. nice break in a hot summer

Services was impeccable and friendly to both the Anglaise et French. Super quaint main floor with additional seating upstairs. This old Montreal eatery feels like it's cut from the street of Paris. Great selection of all things classic French with an outstanding French onion soup. The French onion soup is accented with exceptionally thin slices onions, a savoury scratch broth hinting a sweet after taste from the onions. A perfectly sized 1/4 inch slice of sourdough baguette adorns the surface blanketed by a rich creamy Swiss cheese. My favourite note of this soup is that it is not overloaded by onions and bread. It's constructed with 3/4's brother with the other quarter made up of onions, bread and cheese.C'est magnifique!!!

This was my first time trying savory crepes.  I didn't know what to expect, but the crêpe that I ordered was delicious.  I also ordered a side salad which had a maple vinaigrette salad dressing.  I wasn't expecting this weakness of the dressing, but it was an amazing surprise.  I scarfed down the salad before even thinking about eating the crepe.  When I decided to dig into the crepe, The flavors of the ham, cheese, spinach, and bechamel sauce mixed with the sweetness of the crepe danced on my taste buds.  This place is worth a visit.  My only regret is that I was too full to try the sweet crepe.

One of my fondest memories of touring the old quarter of Montreal is this crêperie!I admit, this ignorant American has very limited French conversational ability, but our waiter, like most of the other Montreal locals, graciously switched to English for us. Apart from being linguistically accommodating, he was extremely friendly and eager to please.The lobster cognac bisque was rich and heavenly (see photos). It was creamy and full of flavor. The cognac was subtle and not overpowering. I don't know if I could eat a whole bowl of it; fortunately, my friends and I shared much of our food.I split a savory crêpe and a dessert crêpe with my friend. Our savory shrimp crêpe was divine. A rich sauce countered the sweet shrimp within. The sauce was even better with bits of lobster throughout. I would definitely get this again.Our dessert crêpe (see photo) was disappointing, not because it was bad, but because everything thitherto had been so awesome, this one couldn't stack up. It was open-faced and loaded with fruits, mostly raspberries and peaches, maple syrup and an excessive amount of whipped cream. Good, but a little too much on the cream and sweet; I was hoping for a lightly sweet crêpe that would highlight the fruit rather than the sugar.I live in Maryland, but I know that when I return to Montreal I will eagerly seek out the Crêperie Chez Suzette!

Went to grab desert there with my Bro. I had the Nutella and banana one & he had one with apple/Cinnamon.  The flavor was amazing and worth the price attached to it. The place is a landmark so it's always packed and you may have some wait times. The staff was friendly and very attentive. We also split a sangria that tasted really good. Located in Old Montreal, this is a good place to visit and have a good crepe!

I'm about to drop some fondue knowledge on you AND give Chez Suzette their centennial review? Now that's what I'm talkin' about...I was all about revisiting this place during my last visit to Old Town, Montreal. I have this on going joke going with my significant other that goes like this "Have you been there before on a date?"* The answer is sadly often yes, because we met in our late 20s/early 30s and are both people that eat out way too often. In whatever city we're in. Anyway, when it was time to play this round I finally got to say "only with my mom and my best friend's little sister." This was bittersweet, as I felt like I won, but then he didn't try to outdo any other scenario. Wow. Talk about TMI. Moving on.I know this is a creperie, but I disagree. Suzette's finest is her fondue. I've had the original emmental and this time the three cheese and pepper. Delicious. I know others say the prices are jacked up because of this touristy location, but I got a bottle of French merlot (No one is drinking merlot!!! -Sad Paul Giamatti) for under $20 and shared the gooey gooey goodness with my SO. The small is definitely enough to share, and they offer to bring you free bread when you run low. They respect bread to cheese ratios, thus I respect Suzette and her three floors of casual Quebecois dining in the heart of this cobble-stoned hood. *This game might sound really passive aggressive but it's actually not.
