It's more like, "But did she have the bartender send you a flaming shot**? I think not! See I'm the best!"**No flaming shots were done at Chez Suzette. She's too classy for that stuff.

We looked all over the place for a restaurant within our budget that was actually open at 11am. We just stumbled upon Chez Suzette. Everyone loved their food! Definitely recommend the paninis and salad.

Stopped in while visiting old Montreal.. it was perfect. I had a crepe with bananas, almonds, toffee cream, and ice cream. Delicious is an understatement. Warmed up with a half pitcher of sangria. Truly enjoyed this place and I will be back when I visit Montreal again.

My husband and I stopped by Crêperie Chez Suzette on our way back from a nice day at Montreal's Old Port this spring. Since he is Texan, I thought it would be a good occasion to have him try another sample of Québécois cuisine. Unfortunately, however, the food turned out to be quite bland; although it didn't taste bad, it lacked the je ne sais quoi which makes a meal memorable. I had the Crêpe Argenteuil and he had Quiche Provençale, both of which seriously lacked seasoning. Other than that, their coffee and drinks were fair and their staff was pleasant enough.Conclusion: Since my cooking's better and tastier, next time I'll Isave my money to buy fresh ingredients and cook those dishes at home.

We came upon this restaurant and loved the ambiance of the seats overlooking the street. There is adorable outdoor seating, but we opted for air conditioning because it was hot. I started with a lemonade which was refreshing and authentic - no Crystal Lite here! The menu is extensive, with fondue, sweet and savory crepes, sandwiches and many cocktails. I ordered a crepe with ham, brie, carmelized onions and maple syrup. It was delicious. I also had bites of the chicken supreme crepe... fabulous. The waiter suggested adding melted mozzarella to the top of that one.. do it! Overall an excellent experience, wouldn't change a thing.

This place serves the best crepe ever. I was recommended by a few locals and tourists to check out this place and so I did. Creperie Chez Suzette is a two-storey building with a patio located in the central tourist area in Old Montreal. It serves a large selection of crepes and fondue. At my visit, I had the French crepe with stuffed ham, Brie and caramelized onions served with 100% pure Quebec maple syrup. It was delicious! It was hands down the best crepe I have ever had.I would highly recommend this place to all! If you're looking for a local authentic meal, this is it!
This was a spectacular find. Best French onion soup I've ever had. Both the sweet and savory crepes were out of this world. Great service, great food, will definitely return!

We came here for a birthday dinner and the service, food, and atmosphere we received was fantastic. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful, and seated us on the second floor where we got a lovely view of the bustling streets of Old Montreal. I ordered La Méditerranéenne Crêpe, a baked crêpe filled with chicken and ratatouille, topped with generous amounts of mozzarella cheese. I also had the Bellini Fraise drink, which tasted a little strong in my opinion (but I'm quite a lightweight). For dessert, two friends and I shared the Fondue au Chocolat pour 2, and the dark chocolate was very smooth and rich. If you tell the waiter that it's someone's birthday, they will bring the dessert out  with a candle in it while singing happy birthday. Overall, I was very satisfied with my meal and will definitely go back there when I get the chance.

Not impressed -- my husband came for desert -- ordered a crepe Besides the fact that the crepe was old and required force to tear it apart the waiter didn't ask us how anything was and we had to sit for 15 min after finishing up get our bill and pay for this terrible meal

Stopped by just in passing after lunch elsewhere for a dessert crepe. We were impressed by a varied menu that included not only a large selection of dessert crepes but also many meat and cheese crepes, varied fondues, and other items. We decided on a crepe with strawberries, bananas, dark chocolate sauce, and vanilla ice cream.....yum! The service was very good and the crepe was delivered quickly. It was a good find!

Came here with the mind set of splitting a crepe. Nope. Each got a dessert crepe. No regrets. Crepe is a bit chewy but overall the quality was so good, fruit is fresh, ice cream is good. A little on the pricey side but that's what you would expect for the crepe. They have a nice patio outside and service is quick. Going into a sugar coma now.

Stopped by for a quick snack with my girlfriend late Sunday afternoon. We were seated quickly in the corner table with a window view of the street which was great for people watching. We ordered a quiche (ham) and panini (chicken, pesto) which came with salad and came out quickly. Good service, good quality, reasonably priced food in Old Montreal. This is a little gem that we were glad to have stumbled upon touring the area. Highly recommend.
So good!The sugar shack special is to die for! So tasty! Also the lady next to me got the shrimp crepe...which looked like heaven on a plate. English/French menu!Wifi password is: suzette3
Wonderful food and service.  We went for dinner after arriving In Montreal with our 3 kids.  Server was great and friendly.  We loved the cheese and chocolate fondue.

Pre-Made disasters:Unable to accommodate my anti-ice cream needs. As a strong advocate against ice cream culture i feel offended and unsafe in this disgusting restaurant. I requested my crepe to be ice cream free but was aggressively denied this basic human right.
We stopped in here for lunch today and what a wonderful decision! We loved our meals and desserts. The crepes are incredible, especially the dessert crepes. Highly recommended.

Solid dessert location for savory and sweet crepes.  Really enjoyed their chocolate fondue as well and the generous amount of fresh fruit and such they give to dip into the chocolate.  Gets really packed and then empty fairly quickly and because they have 3 floors of seating it's virtually no wait to get in and get out.

Admittedly this is a very touristy area and we chose this at random.It was a solidly 3-star experience. My wife had the crepes with Nutella and strawberries, I had the French onion soup. We shared a half pitcher of sangria - very watered down. The waiter was very friendly and quick.If it's a nice day check it out and sit outside, just don't expect a lot from the food.

Although a few dollars more than I would have liked to pay, my crepe with Brie, ham, and caramelized onions was quite good. It came with syrup so at the end I dipped the crepe bits in the extra syrup to get that nice salty sweet. Pretty cute, great location. We needed to get in and out quickly to catch a flight and they were very nice about it.

Not impressed. Waiter seemed to be in a bad mood and my party of 3 felt rushed to place our order. Soup and crepe were good but I couldn't rate my crepe due to the fact that it never came. I love old Montréal but I have to tell you that there are better places for one to spend their tourist dollar.

Came here for a bite while strolling in Old Montreal. Ordered the French onion soup baked with crouton topped with cheese, and also got a ham, brie and spinach crepe topped with bechamel sauce. Didn't really like the soup, thought that there was way too much cheese, about a lb of it sitting on top of the soup which was kind of gross and the base wasn't very flavourful. Crepe itself was very delicious and smelled amazing. The fillings and the sauce worked together but it wasn't my favorite combination. The place itself was pretty big, 3 levels, friendly staff, decent prices. Decent choice for food if you are in the area.
Soup l'ognion de gratinée is a must! French onion soup was spot on!Hubby enjoyed his Le campagnarde crêpe!

This creperie is located in the entertainment/tourist hub of Old Montreal and is a good way to extend one's stay in this area. We had finished earlier on our dinner in the area and wanted to extend our stay before visiting a jazz bar nearby. My friends recommended this spot as they make it a point to visit this place whenever they are in Montreal.The place in unassuming and actually spans 3 floors so there is plenty of seating even when it looks packed from outside. We just wanted to stick to desserts so after going through the extensive menu we all settled on crepes (what else) They do have a decent beer and cocktail selection so it is worth a look.The crepes are big portion as the crepe suzette I ordered was 4 pieces. The stuffed crepes were also quite big. Crepe Suzette was decent though frozen berries were used in the crepes with berry filling. Prices are almost the same as a proper mid/high end restaurant in the area. 3 Stars.

It is not easy to find a place for a Fondue on a Sunday, during lunch time. I've found this place on Yelp and decided to give shot.The place is huge. Two or three floors I think! The service is friendly. I've found the full fondue meal (cheese & meet & chocolate) off MY budget, but not too bad. The cheese fondue was delicious. I loved the veggies that came with it. The meet one was ok. Nothing special. The chocolate... Well... It's chocolate. Of course it was amazing! One thing that bothered me was that the timing wasn't good. It took too long between the services and we spent almost the entire afternoon there. Overall, it was nice for the company we've had, but I'm not sure I'll be back.

Old town is chock full of great restaurants. Chex Suzette is a great choice. I had a crepe with Brie chicken and apples for dinner, and chocolate fondue with fruit for dessert. It was all really good. Only problem is I ate too much!

Walking around the old town, we came across this restaurant. Although they were very busy we were able to get a table right away. They had a upstairs seating that was very nice. Our waiter was very nice and gladly agreed to replace bananas for marshmallows on my dish. But he failed to tell me there will be a charge for replacement. He claimed the cook had added the $2 banana fee. Now I know from eating out for over 40 years, when you ask for a replacement that's just what it is,a replacement. But he did want to offer me the $2 out of his own pocket which I thought was a nice gesture.
Cozy atmosphere with a European feel. Menu was diverse, and the waiter was helpful. On a cold day this is a great place to go for amazing French onion soup and a glass of wine.

Stopped in for a quick bite to eat before doing more sight seeing in Old Montreal.The menu is long with a large variety of salty and sweet choices.We decided on crêpes!1.  Parisienne: apple, brie cheese, with Quebec maple syrup 2. Class Sucre Creme:  toffee creamThe Parisienne crêpe was tasty but the toffee cream was much more delicious!Decor is trying for a quaint Parisian look and feel but falls a bit short with dated fixtures and furniture.  The view from the second and third floor is nice with large talk windows and the atmosphere with the nice summer breeze and the church bells makes for a pleasant dining experience.Wait staff is average and speak both French and English, which helps.

We went here right before closing for dessert. The staff was very pleasant and took our order and served us promptly. We enjoyed the casual, small atmosphere. Nothing fancy inside but the huge crepe made up for it! The crepe was very large, could be shared by two people if you want...The crepes are not your usual very think kind, they are a little thicker and I needed a knife to cut mine. However, it was good, the fruit was fresh, the ice cream was good and the staff was smiley and good natured. I felt bad for people who tried to come in after they turned the sign to "closed". I would've thought that they would've stayed open later but closed at 9.In the middle of Old Montreal. Also saw a couple having the hot fondue dinner - looked very yummy and they said it was good! they ended up having 2 plates of meat. This place is good for couples, families, singles.
Fondue was good, I would totally skip the savory crepes. They were nothing to write much about

The best crepes I've ever had anywhere! You MUST order the cognac and orange zest crepe! It was so delectable, that one cannot help but eat is slow and savor each bite. It also helped that the venue is so cozy and perfect for a quiet date night or quick rest from walking around Old Town. Definitely try this place out for dinner or dessert!

Yum Yum Yum Yum for fondue!We had the swiss cheese fondue to start, followed by the beef broth fondue with chicken and sliced beef. Both were delicious. The dipping sauces were amazing - especially the creamy garlic sauce. We finished with the chocolate fondue with fruit and marshmallows. The hubby had a bowl of french onion soup which was yummy. My girls had the pizza, which they seemed to like.The service was great and the rest rooms were very clean.

I visited this place a few years ago when I had the craving for fondue. Returned and was happy to find that the place still existed. Yes, it's a total tourist trap - but one that doesn't gouge folks then delivers poor food. The cheese fondue selection was sparse but pretty solid and combined with a half liter of wine, meant a splendid albeit lingering lunch. Highly recommend eating on the third floor which had a nicer atmosphere to it. The cheese fondue filled us up, so sadly we didn't have enough space for the meat fondue, which I remembered from last time, was divine and had the superb bonus of drinking the 'soup' after you had finished cooking all your meat in it.

We just wanted a quick snack. Had the Nutella with Banana Crepe and the Cinnamon Apple Crepe. It was okay. Nothing spectacular. Waiter kept refilling the coffee without us having to ask. Very attentive. Checked on us regularly without being intrusive. We came in the afternoon and had a corner table on the first floor. Nice spot for people watching.

We ate here our  first night in Montréal.  We picked it at random and were not disappointed. The food was delish. We did cheese fondue, which was awesome!  They had lots of great dinner and dessert crepe choices. We came back for brunch and had excellent dessert crepes, and the French onion soup is a must! The staff was attentive and friendly, and the ambiance had a cute corner café feel. A gem in a bit of a touristy area.

This restaurant is located in the prime real estate of Old Town Montreal, on Rue St. Paul, where dozens of restaurants are competing for the tourists' dollars.  When we were there on a weekend, the road was closed to traffic and it was completely jam packed.  If you happen to be in the Montreal area, I would recommend that you walk down this street at least once, if only just for the experience.If you love crepes and you happen to be in Montreal, how can you not go to a crepe restaurant?  The crepes here are authentically French style, very thin but with its unique consistency, and not too sweet.  The crepe Suzette is absolutely one of the best.  It's served with an orange sauce made with fresh orange juice and Grande Marnier.  It has such a natural taste that is not syrupy or sugary.This is DA CREPE!If you are not a crepe person, their menu is actually quite extensive.  Other entrees available include soup, salad, sandwiches, pasta, among many other options.On a beautiful day, you'll want to sit outside, even if you have to wait for a table.  This is truly the European style sidewalk café experience.  However, as the real estate here is very precious, expect the space to be crammed and your table is literally just several inches away from your neighbor.  If you expect privacy, this is not the right place for you.Prices are expensive, but so is every other restaurant here in Old Town Montreal.  Service is good and friendly.  Everybody speaks English, although they always greet you in French first.  Bonjour!  Comment allez vous?This is definitely a restaurant which I will revisit every time that I'm in the Montreal area. If you love crepes, you'll love it here!
Man, I hated the ambiance. The outdoor seating looked nice, but indoors it's tacky and plain. Service and the food were both average. Would absolutely not recommend this place.

Our family ate dinner here in the heart of old Montreal.  The food is average. Good solid crepes and pleasant creamy cheese fondue and good salads and nice dark chocolate fruit fondue. Everything was good, workmanlike, and not special.

The crepes were just ok, actually the tea glace (iced) was the best we had but my asparagus crepe was too sweet for a savory filling and rubbery. We were hot and had 2 glasses of the iced tea so that made us happy.

I've been here many times and I would definitely return! Located right in the heart of old Montreal, I feel like I'm in Europe when I come here for crepes. Their cheese fondue was also delicious and worth ordering! I haven't had the best service because the restaurant seems a little slow, especially more so when the restaurant is busy. But their crepes and fondue keep making me come back.

Enjoyed their crepes. Had the Mediterranean crepe ( chicken and vegetables in it with cheese on top) asked for mushroom sauce on the side. Yummy! Service was a bit slow. But it was busy. Located in old Montreal. Nice atmosphere. We were too full to have some dessert crepes. Until another for that then.

Cozy ambiance and delicious food. Their soups and garlic bread are out the world. Crepes are hit n miss , depending on what you order. One of the reasonable priced place in very expensive area of old Montreal for food ...as its tourist driven. Just get a seat by window and enjoy food with cobble Street European feel.

I visited the Creperie on a trip home from Canada. We decided that while passing through Montreal we would stop and get something to eat there. After browsing a few review It was decided that the Creperie sounded the most appealing. We sat downstairs and ordered some drinking and soup and a crepe each. The hot cider I ordered was really good. I opted for the Non-alcoholic version since, this was about the time for brunch; even though I'm sure it was 5 o'clock somewhere. Then the soup came out which was out of this world. It cost about 9 dollars but was completely worth it. Finally I had my bacon and avocado crepe, which was all I had hoped it would be, although not being too surprised as how could you really go wrong with both bacon and avocado in something.  The girl who waited on us was very pleasant the whole time. Overall I was very pleased with the choice of lunch.
The crepe with brie, apples, and maple syrup changed my life.I'm not kidding.

Super homey restaurant with delightful service. The waiter offered to practice French with my table and we all had a good laugh. The meal was a little heavy for my liking, but overall the food is delicious.

We waited outside for about 10 minutes on line for a table seating on a Saturday night. It was probably one of the shorter lines of all the restaurants in the area. I guess that's what a summer night in Old Port is like! I ordered the La Mediterraneene main course crepe with chicken, ratatouille and mozzarella cheese. It was a bit bland and the cheese was not melted as smoothly as expected. My friend had the Neptune crepe and it was a bit salty and too cheesy for her taste. The rose Sangria was tasty and refreshing. Service was not too attentive. Maybe next time we should have tried the fondue or crepes for dessert instead.
2nd trip to Montreal and we had the chocolate fondue once again. Really good deserts and courteous staff.

This place blew my mind ! Their seafood dish was the entree and I had the crepe Suzette for dessert . Best decision ever ! So sad I didn't try their fondues and if I ever have a chance this is where I'd be headed to in Montreal . Beautiful setting with outside seating and really good menu . Portion size is a bit on the smaller side for the entrees but that more than makes up for when you have dessert. Don't order the usual fruit filled crepes try the crepe Suzette instead , it was heaven on a plate ! Shout out to Martin ..xxx :)

I come back to this establishment every time I am in Montreal for both savory and sweet crepes. Staff is very friendly. My only negative comment would be for them to repaint/re-design the place so it is more inviting and pleasing. Right now it is bare bones and a bit used and abused.

This place is terrible not sure how the reviews are so good. 6 of us came and all got different dessert crepes and they were all bad.  Aside from the crepes being ice cold the ice cream was awful.  How the hell do you mess up ice cream.  It tasted terrible and the texture was way off. Worst crepe Suzette I've ever had in my life.  The crepes aside from being frozen we're probably 3x as thick as a crepe should be. The only redeeming quality of this place is that the staff was very friendly.  Tourist Trap, STAY AWAY!
Very good baked French onion soup and quiche Lorraine for lunch! Perfect size! Server was kind and helpful with us since we knew little French. Definitely enjoyed our time at this location!

We stopped in here for a late afternoon lunch on a rainy Sunday and it was still really busy. It isn't really anything special, but the cocktails were really delicious. The food was pretty good but not great. No complaints about the service. The atmosphere needs some updating and a cleanup, and they really need to change the music playlist!

Well.. quite disappointed with the price for the quality... Decided to go there as several places had crazy wait times and this place didn't and was rated 4+ stars on Yelp. Fondues are really pricey for the quality of the meat, and vegetables plates don't necessarily go well with cheese fondue. Nice deserts and friendly service though. May have to try other items , but I would suggest to stay away from the fondues

We stumbled upon this little gem almost by chance, and we were so glad we did.It's a cute little creperie (with all kinds of other food too) located in the Old Port. Very friendly waitresses, and a beautiful intimate feel. Also it didn't have the pomp or prices of the old port, just comfortable and intimate.We ordered a variety of crepes, salads, and soup, and we loved everything. Really great spot and we'll likely come anytime we're in the old port. So happy to find it.
Went here based on the recommendations and it did not let me down. Server was fabulous and so was the food. It was a fantastic spot. Will definitely go back the next time I'm in Montreal.
THE  place to go for dessert crepes. Hands down. Delicious! Out door seating but wide open windows inside gives outside feel. Fresh tasty nice variety. Extremely friendly wait staff.

Chez Suzette was a highlight of our trip to Montreal; the vibe was cozy, the staff friendly, and the food was hearty French deliciousness. Their French onion soup was heavenly -- such a flavorful broth without feeling too heavy (a tough balance to strike!). And highly recommend the sundried tomato fondue as well. We split amongst four people and it was the perfect way to kick off the meal. Can't recommend this place enough!
Great french onion soup, tasty lobster bisque soup, and the "Sonia crepe", sublime! Great fast service.

Loved their crepes with the fruit the French onion soup, the escargot was wonderful, oh yum, the fondue had a bit too much alcohol for us, overpowered the tasting of the cheese, maybe some like it that heavy with the alcohol, next time we will know, there will be a next time! Wonderful staff, our waiter very friendly and thorough, views incredible from the 3rd fl. Worth the climb, go and u won't be sorry, nice visit to that area of Old Montreal, can't wait to go back. It was my husbands 1st visit to Montreal and so pleased that he ate there, insurance we will return to your lovely cafe.

I gave it three stars for the selection, the somewhat helpful wait staff and the great location.  Maybe my expectations were too high. The two crepes lacked flavour, breakfast and spinach & Brie. The breakfast crepe  was really tough. Cutting it was almost a disaster. I really enjoyed the escargot, the onion soup and the overpriced strawberry drink.  The onion soup tasted great but I was expecting it to be fancier, such as a homemade cracker baked on top.

We had a delightful lunch here while wandering around Old Montreal.  The crepe was Brie, ham and apples served with maple syrup and it was delicious.  Our waitress was friendly, efficient and well versed on the menu.  She was very tolerant of my efforts to speak French, but was fluent in both her native French and English as are almost all citizens of this lovely city.

My husband and I needed a little luncheon snack and saw that they have cheese fondue!!! It was the creamiest fondue I've ever had. Delicious and hit the spot. Served with yummy sour dough chunks of bread, fruit and veges. Would have loved to try the chocolate fondue but too full!

This is a wonderful place for a bottle of wine with your better half & some lobster bisque while people watching.  We sat in the outdoor patio where there are only tables for 2. The bisque was amazing, as was our cabernet savignon made in California. Our server was delightful & spoke English. I would love to go back for a other meal.
Service- excellentAmbiance- goodFood - I've had betterI got the Swiss fondue and was not impressed... The ingredients did not seem fresh and overall it was bland

We came for breakfast and sat on the beautiful patio and had wonderful service. All 5 of us loved our crêpes!! The Parisienne especially, with brie and green apples, yummmm. I would highly recommend, great food, service and ambiance for the price.

Great little spot. This is the right place if you are people who enjoy tasty food AND you have little kids in-tow. We ended up coming her twice during our 5 day visit. Lunch and then dinner. Husband and I enjoyed wine with our cognac drenched lobster bisque, spinachy crepes and VERY good French onion soup. Kids had eggs and ham crepes with real maple syrup (seriously America, stop serving that fake stuff!). Kids were even willing to try escargot here and found out they like them! A very good, simple, caesar salad here, too. Waiters are friendly and attentive, were sweet to my kids and not fussy. A great spot to make everyone happy.

I had my very first crêpe here a few years ago and I've addicted, ever since. This beautiful, romantic, little crêperie is well worth a visit. The atmosphere and food were amazing and made a lasting impression. I'll never forget this place and hope to return someday. Highly recommend!

Looks very good.  Big menu, lots of seating!  Hot upstairs though!  We ordered dessert crepes.  Found a way to open the window by our table and drank in the cool night breezes.  The crepes were huge, and wonderful just the right amount of sweetness.

I was suspicious of a resto in this busy tourist place but it resulted great! It is a spacious place with three floors and a large menu as well. I had the chicken and mushrooms, i found it savory and with really chicken flavour delicious!  Our waitress Pedro was fantastic!! Muchas gracias.
Great savory crêpes and pretty authentic place in Vieux Port. The portions were more than filling and the staff was really friendly. If you feel like having crêpes, this is where you go ;)

Beware: the coke is not offical post mix but a rip off no name brand cola.The quiche is microwaved to the same temperature of the sun and only given a spoon to eat it with.Complimentary bread came out after the mains not warmed with butter and still no other utensil but a spoon.French onion soup was quite bland but the cheese on top was nice, maybe a 2/5.Lobster bisque has more cognac than any other flavour, a 1/5.Vegetable quiche 1/5, frozen, microwaved then smashed in the oven.The McDonald's around the corner would provide more satisfaction.

Delicious food and great price for a quick lunch on our first day in Montreal. I had the vegetable quiche and my friend had a breakfast crepe. Both were delicious. A lovely lunch place right in the heart of Old Montreal.

GREAT find by accident. We were seated upstairs, at an adorable, sunny table for two overlooking the street below. Such a wonderfully quaint view. We ordered and shared the crepes la québécois and la delice  aux Framboise. Both very delicious! I plan to return before our visit to Montreal is over this weekend! You have to try it out!!!

Awesome food and service make this a wonderful place to grab breakfast, lunch or dinner. I got the Sugar Shack Special and was loving every bite. That said, it's Old Port so it is on what I would consider the pricey side. One crepe and a drink will run you about 30$. If you're okay with that, enjoy!

Located in the old port of Montreal, this three-stories restaurant has a warm and cozy feeling and a great selection of crepes, with meats or as desserts! I tried shrimp crepe, which was something very new to me and I absolutely loved it!

Nice fun place to dine and people-watch, but don't expect cuisine. We got a table inside overlooking the procession on St. Paul St, a great view. But the cheese fondue - one of their specialties - was a huge disappointment. Instead of baguette chunks, we got cranberry bread, olive bread - soft, gummy breads. And the cheese lacked the punch you get from kirsch; our packaged fondue from Trader Joes tastes better. The Caesar salad - admittedly a side order - was devoid of Caesar flavor; just chopped lettuce and croutons. Likewise, their Suzette Sundae, a concoction of Grand Marnier,  cognac, and ice cream, was mostly melted ice cream, more to be slurped thru a straw than eaten with a spoon. Food was definitely phoned in. The resto is attractive, outside and in; service was fast and friendly and responsive. I just wish the food had been as likable. 3 stars max.

We went for Fondue, but ended up tasting it and giving it back. We than ordered a crepe with nutella and bananas and got a Crepe with Nutella and strawberries instead.... I also ordered a cup of hot tea but never got it... waitress wasn't great... the reason for 3 Stars is; she didn't charge us for the Fondue...If you go, try the crepes, the fondue isn't great at all...Will I be back? Possibly...
Fair value, quality and setting for Old Quarter.  Warm goat cheese salad and BLT panini were very good, and apple dessert crepes did not disappoint.

The staff was very friendly, and the ambiance was cute, but unfortunately, the food was a miss. I ordered the La Speciale Delice crepe but it was very bland and not worth $14.99. On the other hand, the Viennese coffee was pretty good.

This was an unexpected treat. Food was fantastic and priced right. I read the review here on the fruiti du mar which was given a "to die for" comment so I decided to try it. While it may not be "To die for" it is very VERY good. I could tell the seafood was cooked fresh as the shrimp was done to that perfect slight crunch and not over cooked to a chewy consistency like some seafood pies. My wife had the Quiche Loraine which she said was as good as mine and the crust may be better. I tasted it and she was right. My son had the the Ham cheese and asparagus crepe and French onion soup he ranked as a 4 and 5 respectively. As for the ambiance, the pictures say it all. Oh and of course we had desert crepes with cappuccino as well. Mmmm.

The service was very nice. The food was delicious. The portions were large. The salad dressing was really good. There are three levels and it has a certain charm. The fondue for one it big enough for 3 people. Yum!  The Bloody Mary was really just vodka in tomato juice. That was the only thing we didn't love. Good coffee.
Great dinner spot.  Staff was attentive and the food exceeded expectations.

Great fondue and soups. Poor service. Waitstaff non responsive to requests unless you asked multiple times. Took 15 minutes from getting check to processing payment. Waited 10 minutes for waiter to come back to take order after he said he would right back.   In the meantime he cleared off two other tables
perfect little stop just around from out hotel. Friendly staff and crepes were delicious

Cute little restaurant and sidewalk café on one of the most beautiful streets anywhere. I had the roast beef sandwich on focaccia bread and it was delicious. Nice sized too. On the day that we were there, it took forever to get waited on, but to be fair, it was the lunchtime rush. Once we finally did get waited on, everything went without a hitch.I'd like to go back and try breakfast here some time. With sidewalk dining in fair weather, this is a perfect place to relax and enjoy the sights. Fun for people watching too.

We were in a pinch for food and came across this neat little crepe place on Rue St Paul.  Great central location in heart of Vieux Montreal.  Excellent spot for people watching.  Our server was excellent.  I did not try the crepes but I had the coquille aux fruits de mer, which was a magnifique dish!  Highly recommend this dish!  The shrimp and scallops mixed with the mushroom, white wine and lobster sauce topped with cheese was unbelieveable!  It was not big portions but it was enough to get me by in the early afternoon.
The savory crepes have no taste, completely bland and overpriced... Look elsewhere in Montreal for crepes...

Gorgeous crepes (made my husband and I feel slightly sick all day afterwards, so not sure what was up with that). My kids liked the pancakes and hot chocolate. Great location in the old port area, near all the touristy shops. But a fun neighborhood to walk around. The fondue was ok - not really worth the space in your belly.
The food was amazing! Our server Oliver was excellent, helping our daughter find just what she wanted. The atmosphere was comfy and authentic. Altogether a wonderful experience!

This is my favourite place to go in Montreal. I love their brie and caramelized onion sandwich, which comes with a light and perfectly dressed salad. Their crepes are also fantastic and their french onion soup is a must have. Great service, good price, yummy food. Can't wait to come back.

Maybe it's because I've probably only had one Crepe in my life before this point, but I was very impressed.  I stopped in for breakfast on a Sunday morning and could not have been happier.  I ordered a Crepe with scrambled eggs, ham, bacon, cheese, and pure maple syrup.  I'm not sure what it was that made this breakfast that was seemingly identical to every other breakfast I would get at a diner, but it was outstanding.  After that I was told I had to try a dessert Crepe so I split one with my coworker.  We got one with chocolate sauce, bananas, strawberries, and vanilla ice cream.  My mind was blown.  I'm very happy that Chez Suzette opened my eyes to the world of Crepes.  I'll probably be back for more next weekend.

Had the Mediterranean crepe with chicken and ratatouille and it was absolutely delicious! The ground floor was super cozy right along Saint Paul. Le Remy was a delicious drink and so was the Cidre Chaud, however the Cidre Chaud seemed a little overpriced given how tiny the cup was. Nonetheless delicious food and drinks in Old Port!
Loved the 3 meal selection. Cheese fondue, beef fondue and chocolate fondue. Great time with a great person and great location.
Good clean place. Great ambience. Slow service. I wouldn't come here again for the main courses. Great deserts. Must visit only for deserts. Great fondue.

We came here around 4:00 on a Sunday afternoon for a light snack before dinner. Suzette's manages to be a very friendly and approachable restaurant for tourists without compromising on food quality. The service was excellent. We felt comfortable and welcome immediately. We enjoyed an asparagus crepe with bechamel, a ham and cheese crepe, and Swiss fondue. Overall we left totally stuffed and didn't end up eating dinner until around 9pm because we were so satisfied by the food at Suzette's. Highly recommend!!

I love this creperie in Old Montreal. I sat facing the window that opened up to the street so everything taste better you know? Had savoury crepe with melted brie cheese, sauteed onions and believe chicken? The half melted brie did it all... It was so good. The cafe au lait I ordered was only mediocre though, for $3.50 or sth I expect better cup of coffee! But it's ok the crepe was so good. I was pretty full to try any dessert crepe but for sure I'd love to come back.

I'm guessing Chez Suzette is pretty much just for the tourists based on the area it's in but if I lived in Montreal I think I'd brave the tourists to frequent this place.  It has a warm and cozy atmosphere, vegetarian options and reasonable prices for the portions and taste. I opted for the L'Argenteuil crepe, asparagus, bechamel sauce, and pine nuts in a crepe, then there's cheese on top and it's baked. OH MY GOOD GOD it was heaven wrapped in cream sauce and baked with cheese.  I asked to add mushrooms to the crepe and they came on the side.  At first I thought, that's weird, but it was nice to have a mushroom with every bite.   My husband opted for the Crepe aux Avocats, which boasted pesto, avocados, and tomatoes. He added swiss cheese, which was also baked on top.  It was a refreshing and yummy crepe but nothing compared to the fatty, rich, creamy crepe that I ordered.  He was jealous.  My reasoning for 4 of 5 stars instead of a full 5 is that the asparagus was just slightly tough.   A senior tour sat next to us and cracked me up with their Seinfeld's parentsesque comments.  They also seemed pretty happy with their meals.  If old people like it it must be good right?
very good French onion soup.  lots of variety. great for a quick casual lunch. service was a bit slow though.
Excellent location. Superb service. Child friendly. Fresh crepes. Delicious apple cider. You really must go and try for yourself.
We enjoyed a stop at Suzette for crepes and fondue.  We enjoyed the salad and French onion soup as well as the savory crepes and ended our meal with fondue.  Friendly and fast service.
The waitress's recommendation, Butter sugar crepe with strawberry, was really good, but I am pretty sure I can find the better one in somewhere. not that special, but it was good.

OMG I LOVE THEIR NUTELA CREPES TOPS WITH STRAWBERRIES AND WHIP CREAM!!!!!I was visiting montreal and heard about this place! so I went to try it out and omg it was sooooo goood!!!! located in old montreal...we stayed in the intercontinental hotel so it was like a walking distant to this place.

I'd probably say 3.5, but I'm rounding down because I probably wouldn't go back. We stumbled into this place as we were wandering around Old Montreal, my boyfriend insisting he wanted to eat something authentic. To him that meant only french things or poutine, so here we were.I honestly have no complaints about this place. The food I ordered was very good (assorted seafood baked in a lobster bisque sauce), the view overlooking Rue St. Paul and a bit of the bay was fantastic, and the service was prompt, polite and attentive. They also offer some of the cheapest bottles of wine I've ever seen in any restaurant ever. The problem is that somehow the experience was lacking. Maybe it's because the restaurant was kind of empty. Not in a cozy romantic way, but in a way where you feel a little awkward that you're the only people in the room.  Maybe because even though the service was good, it was also a little cold. Maybe its because even though everything was good, nothing wowed me (except those wine bottle prices!).It's a perfectly good restaurant that I have no real interest in returning to. Make of that what you will.

Excellent crepes!  Strong, good coffee.  Big portions.  Great for breakfast.  Very accomodating for kids.  Strongly recommend for a simple affordably priced breakfast in old Montreal on a charming street.  Try the salmon, cream cheese and caper crepe!

This place was amazing. We searched all over old Montreal for a fondue place and this definitely hit the spot. Our server, Stephany was the sweetest person ever. We had the bruschetta and French onion soup to start as well as the trio of fondue. The cheese was incredible, and the beef broth for the second course was so succulent. We would definitely return!
Incredible food and great atmosphere at a good price!

We stayed right on Rue St Paul in the heart of Old Montreal and found this a very convenient spot to have a relaxing lunch on a cold snowy afternoon.We decided to have one of the special combos for two for $59.95.We each started with a caesar salad.Next we had each had a choice of either french onion soup or escargots.  My wife chose the former and I chose the latter.  Both were well executed and perfect on such a cold afternoon.Next came the cheese fondue.  It tasted like the fondue that my mother would have made for us back in the 1970s.  They served it with 3 types, or so, of bread and some cut up apples.Lastly, we got to choose between crepe suzette or crepe viennoise.  My wife chose the former and I chose the latter.  I am not big fan of Grand Marnier so I didn't even taste hers.  However, she said it was excellent.  I enjoyed the chocolately goodness of mine.It was a good stop and enjoyable meal!

We came here for lunch while touring Old Montreal and it was pretty nice for a place clearly geared (and priced) toward tourists. The hot beverage selection was a nice treat after walking around in the cold winter weather. I was pretty excited about the option of sugarless iced tea.We shared a cheese fondue with herb and sun-dried tomato. It came with a basket of bread, apples, and grapes. It was very tasty, the temperature was good, and the basket of dippables was unlimited. There were a few apple pieces and grapes that bruised, but otherwise tasty. Our server was mr. smiley--he was friendly, prompt, and it was easy to get his attention. The hostess seemed to have too much on her plate--running around and busing tables to get please seated faster. However, it was strange that we had to wait for a table while the patrons finished up and paid, and then two other parties were seated while we were waiting.

Their Neptune crepe blew my mind! Soooo delicious. (Be warned- it's very "seafoody.") We had their cheese fondue as an appetizer, and it was amazing. The server brought us extra bread for it (which we gobbled up, too.) The ambiance was cozy and comfortable, without feeling too "nice" if that makes sense. (Basically, I didn't feel too out of place with my two year old dining with us. ;))

Mmm des crepes. I just had to get some crepes in montreal. And wny not get the classic crepe suzette (orange sauce, grande marnier and powered sugard) and a fruit salad on the side. cute little place great for breakfast.

This quaint little French restaurant is in the middle of Old Montréal, so my family and I had lunch here. I ordered La Parisienne, which was delicious and came with 100% Quebec Maple Syrup. The restaurant was a bit small on the inside, but it did have enough room. We were seated by the window, which was pleasant and warm. Our waiter was attentive, and service was prompt. Overall, loved the experience and would recommend.

I think I was spoiled by the small crepe stand outside of the Notre Dame in Paris or something... yes, I am fully bragging right now. The crepe was okay, but too chewy and dense for my crepe liking. The Viennese chocolate was not very good. Where was the chocolate and cream? When I get anything Viennese, I want that cream like a mountain on the top. Like obnoxious amounts of whipped cream. Decent if you are starving, but I'd pass otherwise. Service was attentive, but a bit rushed.
Bland tourist food. Food came barely warm. Bland dry chicken in chicken/ratatouille crepe with bland barely-melted mozzarella. Lobster bisque ok but little hint of lobster or sherry.
We wanted to stay with the Parisian theme, so stopped by this cute little place. We had different crepes and chocolate fondue to finish it up. Friendly service and quick turn around.

A gorgeous view of old Montreal and a fun environment! I ordered a savoury and sweet crepe which complimented each other well! The waiter was very friendly and I enjoyed the food! The best part is the scenery though! A wonderful location!

The dessert crepe here with bananas and almonds is one of the top three desserts I've had in my life.  My husband and I stumbled across it in 2010 and purposely sought it out on this trip, now with our 2-year-old.  It lived up to the memory we had of it, and even our toddler loved it.  We didn't try the meal crepes, but we can't say enough about the dessert crepes here.  We will go out of our way to eat here every time we come to Montreal.
Had their crepes Parisian that was excellent. Very good service from a friendly waiter who spoke three languages

OMGLove their crepes.  Had their la sonia crepe and a latte which ended up being $20.  But oh so delicious and filling.  Instead of having it as a dessert, that ended up being my dinner.  The crepe was thick enough to withstand the fillings.  It's not that thin where you can't even taste the crepe.  And they sure are generous with the fillings.  Delicious.  Latte wasn't strong enough though.

What's not to love about this place... yummy savory crepes and cafe au lait. We liked the crepes so much we came back twice during our trip. I love the egg, swiss cheese and avocado crepe. The restaurant looks small with limited seating until you walk upstairs to go to the washroom and discover an extensive upper dining room enough to seat 50.

Oh my gggggawwwwwd. If i ever want to get really fat i'm just going to live here and go nuts eating crepes and quiche while drinking whipped cream covered cappuccinos. I came here with three other friends on a recent trip to Montreal and all of us had to roll out of the restaurant after. It's the kind of place you go to where the portions are huge but you still eat the whole thing because it's so damn good.One of my friends and i got seafood crepes, which was delicious because- lets face it- everything is good when it's covered in baked cheese and is filled with rich, creamy bechamel sauce. Another friend got a bacon and avocado crepe, which he said was good, but after seeing the deliciousness of our seafood crepes he felt like he could have made a better selection. Another friend got the quiche, which looked amaziiiiing. The crust seemed really golden and flakey. My cappuccino was also delicous... And that would be because it arrived covered in whipped cream and chocolate powder. If they had asked i would have said no whipped cream to try make a tiny attempt at being healthy, but if it arrives that way i'm not gonna complain!I'll definitely be back here next time I'm in Montreal! I try to eat healthy, but when i don't i love splurging on food like this- so damn good and totally worth the food coma!!

The smoothies were amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  My crepe of chicken and mushrooms was very good. The waiter, Pedro, was very kind and attentive! The service was very fast! You may think that crepes only work with sweet things, not true. The breakfast crepe, my brother says, is really good. I tried the maple syrup.  The music was superb! This is possibly one of the best places I've every eaten at, and definitely the best in Montreal! The dessert looked just as good as it tasted. It was amazing!!! I came here another day and there was a waiter named Martin. We asked him for directions to some places and he gave us everything we anted plus more! This place was so good that the four days I was in Montreal, I came here 2 times!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
This was the very first restaurant I ate at in Montreal. I had extremely fast service and the food was to die for! If you in Old Montreal, you must stop by and check it out!
Another must when visiting Old Montreal. Service was good, and the food was delightful. From the light snack to the decadent desert, you can't go wrong here.
Not great... Not bad.  Probably around average for the Old Port.   Fondue is just decent, wine prices are really good, crepes are ok.

Stopped in for a quick bite before we hit the road back into the states.  Very solid place.  Not the most amazing crepes in the world but still very good.  Would really like to give 3.5 stars but since I can't do that I'll give it 3 because rounding up to 4 would just be a little too much for this place.

This was a delicious stop for lunch...in fact so good we came back for a late dinner after Cirque de Soleil ended.  Lunch was desert crepes and my granddaughter declared the Sonia the best thing she ever ate!!!!!  My son, who is violently allergic to eggs, really loved the fondu.  Go there!!!

Stopped here for lunch, after taking a walking tour, and very glad we did. The food was very pleasant, we had the lunch special, which included soup, crepes, tea, and a dessert for the incredible bargain price of $9.99 CAD. All of the food was well-prepared, tasty, and served by a very friendly waiter, in timely fashion, and all in a lovely, welcoming, atmosphere, in a quirky old building in Old Montreal. If you find yourself in the Old Port, and want a pleasant meal, this place is worth a try.
I found the food light and flavorful. Very balanced. Service was terrific. Le Parisienne crepe was great as was Swiss fondue.
Worst crepes I've had. Dessert crepes were cold and rubbery. Definitely not fresh. The ice cream had a bad taste. I would never eat here again.

Ate here first day in Montreal. Food was very fresh, service was good. Ordered a chef salad and bruschetta.  Both delicious.  The dressing on the salad was super tasty; mustard vinaigrette.  I would definitely eat here again.  This place is usually a busy..definitely a good sign.

Came for a dessert crepe on an evening and we tried 'La Jamaicaine' which had banana, ice cream, and Belgian chocolate sauce. The fixings were delicious but the crepe was a bit tough and chewy.  It seemed to have been made ahead of time and reheated.  A bit disappointed. First time there so not sure if it was an off night.  The service was very good and friendly.

Crepes are mediocre at best. Barely any nutella. Feels like they opened up a store bought crepe, spread as thin of a nutella layer as they could and microwaved it. If you're ok with mediocre crepes than go for it. But i suggest paying a few more dollars and going to Cacao 70 10mins away for a real crepe.

I am a huge fan for crepes. But I have to say it is disappoint after dinning over there.We have tried Shrimp crepe, chicken crepe, ham crepe, and dessert crepe. I like crispy crepe but the style of this restaurant is soft with heavy gravy sauce. None of us finished our crepe. Won't be back.

Well my first bad review. Still not feeling well after this place. I and my husband together are still recovering. Had lobster bisque ( way way way too salty), French onion soup was the only win, chicken caesar salad ( such bad chicken imitation), crepe was pretty bad too. Guys at fast food places do a better job. Very disappointed over all. Service was good

Food was okay. I went for lunch and I got the chicken club, and it wasn't anything special. The interior was very nice and clean, and the location was perfect. The prices were very fair, especially for the location. The sandwich and side salad cost me about $9 CAD. I also got a smoothie called the CocoLoco in addition to my sandwich, and that was probably one of the better smoothies I've had in recent memory. Would I come back? Probably not. The food wasn't bad by any means, it just didn't stand out to me as a place I must visit when touring the city. Nevertheless, it was a decent place to eat in Old Montreal without blowing the wallet.
With all of the French choices on Rue St Paul this was a pleasant surprise. Very authentic and pleasing.

My wife and I shared sangria, savory crepe with chicken, spinach and Brie (slight up charge to substitute chicken for ham) and finished with chocolate fondue.   Great food, nice casual atmosphere and it was a bonus that our waiter, Jolain, on the third floor was terrific.

This place was great! This was just what you needed to get out of the cold Montreal air.  The French onion soup was absolutely delicious. We ordered the sun dried tomato cheese fondue and the waiter gave us extra bread. Loved the atmosphere, server and food - very cozy place and exceptional service. Great price too! I highly recommend :D
Great service and Crepes we're incredible.  Highly recommend this place when in Montreal

Was looking for a low-key kid friendly place while visiting Montreal.  This place was great and fit the bill perfectly.  We were in search of dinner, so didn't have the chance (or the room in my stomach) to try a dessert crepe, although they looked amazing as everyone else in our section appeared to be there solely for dessert.  Wife ordered the French onion soup and the Montreal crepe, which she enjoyed.  I ordered the shrimp crepe served with a nice lobster sauce.  A lot of shrimp included in TWO crepes.  Very yummy.  Kids just got spaghetti and milkshakes which got good reviews as well.  Probably a bit more expensive than I would normally spend for my family of four, but very good nevertheless.  It took awhile to get our food, but the waiter (Olivier) was super pleasant and professional very quick to get our drinks refilled.  Super service.
Wonderful. Great food (we had fondue, cidre, crepes), amazing service, very decent prices. We loved it.
Best crepe we have had in a long time. Old Montréal hidden gem. The fondue was amazing as well.

They had a very good menu with lots of choices. That whole vegetarian section which is just fine by me. They had a good selection of wines as well as apple cider. The place is big inside as well as you can sit outside. The crapes were delicious and the portions plenty. My friends also had crepes as well as a salad and soups and they were very satisfied and finished all their portions. The service was attentive and friendly. I would recommend this place and definitely return.

We had a friend visiting Montreal from the States for the first time, and figured crepes were a must! We happened upon Chez Suzette in the old port late Sunday morning, and were seated right away (there are 3 floors!). I had the French onion soup au gratin ($8) and escargots ($7). The escargots were delicious and garlic-buttery, served with little white dinner rolls. The onion soup was also very good - lots of cheese, flavourful broth, and soft onions. The bread in the soup was quite soggy, and would have been better if toasted first. Regardless, it was a nice bowl of comfort.Our friend had the crepe with apples, brie and maple syrup ($14).  It was amazing! The crisp apples and gooey cheese were the perfect combination.My boyfriend has the special delice ($14) - a breakfast crepe with eggs, meat, cheese and mushrooms - and loved it. The service was good and relatively fast. Will definately go back!

We went here twice. Once for dessert and once for dinner. The dessert crepe was better than the savory crepe. When we went there for dessert, we had the La Sonia crepe. It had strawberries, bananas, ice cream, whipped cream, and chocolate sauce. Nothing was left on the plate! For dinner, I had a salad with avocado, strawberries, mixed greens, etc. It was a nice, refreshing salad. If you don't love crepes, there are many other options on the menu which I did not have. I would definitely have dessert if I went back again.

this place was so cute! stopped by because my brother had wanted crepes and were pleasantly surprised to find this place! i had a savory crepe while my brother got a dessert crepe and both were excellent. staff was super friendly. pretty decent prices too! if i were to visit montreal again this place is a must visit!!

Terrible service if you are Asian. When we first walked in,  we were asked whether we had a reservation and we didn't.  We left and called and told there was plenty of space and so we went back. After looking forward to eat some fondue,  it came and had such a strong white wine flavor which meant it hadn't fully evaporated.  It was super disappointing because there was no mention of white wine in the description at all. We thought our waitress had removed it from the bill so when we asked her she said she forgot to add it. We then said that it should be because it was not advertised and we barely ate it. She was clearly unhappy and we just got attitude thereafter.  Little did she know we would have left a big fat tip if she didn't give us the unnecessary attitude when we were polite the entire time and clearly did not like the fondue! It was barely touched! French onion soup was okay,  lobster bisque was okay and the crepes were good. Don't expect great service if you're asian as was confirmed by a fellow local resident. Super disappointed.

Excellent breakfast crepes. We all enjoyed this place. A little pricey for breakfast but what can you expect from Old Montreal.No ambiance. Decent coffee. Worth going to if you are staying in Old Montreal.

I'm not a picky eater and I normally don't write bad reviews but this place is a one star.  Terrible service, foods was really bad, the eggs weren't cooked properly and the crepe was very rubbery and dry. Do not recommend it

great savory and sweet crepes...a nice cozy vieux montreal location...fancy names attached to the crepes as well :P....Crepes were a little bit on the chewy side...mine was little less but when i tasted some of my friends plate...i felt sorry for my friend...with all the hype of chez suzette...its failing to stand upto its expectations

Oh my goodness. Yummy! We got the vegetable soup (French onion style with baked cheese on the top) as our starter. It was good. For our main we got two crepes: The asparagus with bechamel sauce. Unreal, seriously. The other one was apple, brie and maple syrup. Again, we couldn't get enough. They were delicious! The service was good too. They layout of the restaurant is interesting and the sunlight floods in. Overall, it was a great experience!

Beeeees everywhere! They don't bother you too much but they will eat your food and drink your drink. You just have to take turns. Food tasty and location sociable and enjoyable ... just expect to be in the background of many pictures if you're seated outside since people like to pose at the entrance to this strip. Perfect photobombing opportunities.As of 9/2/12 ... they were hiring.

I had a pretty great dining experience here. The service was nice; the only complaint I have about them is the fact that they decided to seat is downstairs next to the door when they had plenty of seating upstairs.The food on the other hand was pretty good. I ordered the crepe, La Florentine, which was really simple but very tasty. It had spinach, Brie, and some creamy sauce that blew my mind. Their drinks, from which I chose some Kirs, were great.Would recommend.

My husband and I clearly ordered incorrectly here.  We had the cheese fondue, not particularly hot or very tasty.  The salad that came with it was mediocre.  However, service was personable and the crepes did LOOK wonderful!

I happened upon this Creperie while on a morning stroll down by the port. The servers were friendly and accommodating beyond my expectations, the pear and Brie crepe I ordered was delectable, and the freshly squeezed orange juice was refreshingly delicious.

Stumbled upon while walking Old Town. Yummy crepes and soups. Returned for dinner since we enjoyed the experience so much & not disappointed. Love the colorful interior. Upstair window table is enjoyable

I'm not sure about what was mentioned about being Asian. We were 11 Asian people and was turned away that they didn't have one table or even two tables to accommodate 11 people. Unfortunately, we didn't get to try their food. Surprisingly from what I read from the reviews, they are 3 floors but no tables to accommodate a group of 11 people. I want to give it 0 star but there's no option in Yelp to give 0 star. It wasn't even worth the 1 star.
Generous, delicious portions.  We got the crepe with shrimp and chicken ratatouille crepe.  We barely were able to finish them:  They only take Amex and MasterCard.

Hard to find French restaurant which is vegetarian friendly. But we did it somehow and it turned out to be really good. Location is the prime factor. Beautiful place to eat at. Be prepared to wait longer to be seated during summer weekends...

My children (12 and 14 year old boy and girl), really enjoyed ourselves and our meal.  We all ordered lunch crepes and they were delicious.  Afterwards the kids ordered chocolate fondue.  The service was great!  The food was excellent.
Not the best crepes we had in Montreal but you can't beat the location or the view. When the weather is nice it's a great place to sit and people watch.

Seriously great French onion soup. Cheese baked on top and bread soaked inside. Perfect for q cold day. The crepes were coked perfectly, I highly recommend the banana and Nutella. Hostess quite rude but the waiter and manager were friendly.
Very good atmosphere.  The staff was very friendly.  Service was amazingly fast.  The took kids with no problem.  I would recommend for any tourist if you'd like a quick and easy taste.

When you're on vacation anything goes. An by anything I mean consuming a giant-sized dish of crepes, smothered in vanilla ice cream drizzled with Belgian chocolate, and piled high with strawberries and bananas--FOR BREAKFAST!On a snowy Montreal morning, we sat on the street level of this charming little creperie, watching the passersby and wondering how on earth they survived this weather without proper bundling! I kid you not, some of these people were in track jackets or heavy sweatshirts! I was but only thankful to be inside this warm, delicious smelling restaurant!With three floors and several pages of crepes to choose from (plus quiche and other fun foods) you'll find a place to plant your bum and some yum to fill your tum in no time!

The french onion soup and crepes but best of all the hot chocolate!  Chocolat au chaud!!  This restaurant is like a little cozy, several stories of goodness.  A lot of tourists but SO WHAT!  The waiter was cordial and told us what tourists usually order so we actually went against all of that.. since we wanted to be different! HAHAHAAnyways, aside from the soup, we ordered the escargot.  Also ordered a few crepes to try.  It was all very good.  I am so glad to have checked out this place!

Housed in a small three story building in Old Town Montreal's touristy cobblestone district sits Creperie Chez Suzette (CCS) I sat myself inside CCS and found it quaint despite the bustling streets. I think that the French country decorations added to the quaintness to it. I sat at a table at the front of the restaurant near the open windows to people watch. It provided great entertainment while I waited for my order.It serves crepes in hardy sizes, sizes that I've never seen before, even in Paris. I could barely finish the first one. Admittedly, I had a small salad before hand that may have damped my eating capacity.CCS is moderately priced for a wide variety of crepes from vegetarian to the rich and dangerous sweet filled crepes sauced in chocolate, saddled with ice cream and filled with fruit - strawberries or bananas.

Lovely friendly staff.  Stopped in for dessert and wine.  Had Jamaican Crepes and toffee Crepes.House wine a true bargain at $12.95 for a 1/2 carafe.Wish I had the chance to go back again. It is very casual, fine for families and the food is really nice.

What more could you want?  Delicious, hearty crepes.  People watching from the third floor window.  They saved us when our blood sugar was low from too long of a walk through Montreal.  Merci, Chez Suzette!  Merci!

We've been to Montreal 4 years in a row for vacation (an annual music festival keeps bringing us back) and we always eat at Chez Suzette twice. Once for yummy savory crepes and once for decadent fondue! The salads are nice too.The first time we got the fondue, we went for 2 servings which was WAY too much for 2 people. Get 1 serving of cheese fondue and you'll have room to enjoy the salad and maybe a dessert. Personally I didn't LOVE the chocolate fondue b/c it was not sweet enough for my tastes. But everything else I've had here was really wonderful.

We got the strawberries and nutella crepe.  The crepe was nice and chewy with a thin layer of nutella (not overwhelming to make the crepe too sweet or soggy) with a scoop of ice cream in the middle and sweet strawberries.  A very good crepe overall!

A delicious choice for this beautiful strech of shops and restaurants down in Old Montreal.  We ate here at about 11am and sat upstairs where we could look down on the cobblestone streets below.  I had the crepes with smoked salmon, capers, red onion, lemon, cucumber and cream cheese.  They forgot the cream cheese but gave me some on the side which was okay with me.  I constructed each bite the same and the cream cheese was helping the bits of red onion, capers and tomato stay on my perfect little bites.  My wife made fun of me for this.My wife had apples, brie and maple syrup inside her crepes and let me tell you, that was outstanding... unbelievable flavor and it had sweet, savory and creamy in every bite.  This was real maple syrup as well which definitely has a distict flavor which wouldn't have worked as well if it were corn starch american pancake syrup.Our only regret was that it was morning still or my wife would have had one of their specialty drinks which was a blackberry icecream shake, booze, cherry juice and fudge.  Yeah, sounds too good to be true.

So here's the thing - it's a bit overpriced, it is in a prime tourist location, the outside patio is lovely, if you sit inside the decor isn't that great but you still have nice views from the windows, and the crepe dough isn't that good.  However, it's very comfortable and accepting - meaning you will feel at home from the staff as a nice little stop in your day, a nice little spot to get away from it all for a moment.  The crepe fillings, as others have said, definitely make up for the flavor of the bland and a bit tough crepe batter they use, so choose your filings wisely knowing you'll want stronger flavors.  It does come with syrup if you get a savory crepe and the syrup isn't that super by Canadian standards, but it makes it nice and it's fun for you if you haven't tried this in Canada yet.  They have a range of special cocktails and wines and beers as well as of course the typical non-alcoholic beverages on offer.  So it's kind of worth it if you are in the area touring to just sit down and have a decent meal in a comfortable spot.  However, if you want real Montreal crepes, go to the Jean-Talon Market.  There is a stand there that is fantastic and the syrup is truly A+.

A must for crepes! This was our first trip to old Montreal and we attended different locations for a crepe each night. We chose the "la sonia" crepe.  This was the best dessert we had whe compared to various other locations in the area.  We also came back for lunch at Chez Suzette. The quiche was melt in your mouth delicious. The menu had many options to choose from. Will definately go back!

As first-timers in Old Montreal and ones with young kids, we were thankful to have come upon this place.  After an exciting day at the Montreal Science  Center (which is very, very close from here), we were all starving!  We thought that this place was perfect for us that night because the ambience was charming, if not romantic, and yet, very accommodating to little ones.  We were fortunate to have a server who was very sensitive to our family's needs.  She suggested that we share the crepes with our daughters (as opposed to ordering separate for us) because they were big enough servings. So, that worked out well.  In fact, in the end, we were all too full for desserts.  We had the La Quebecoise (with Swiss cheese, ham and Quebec maple syrup) and the Chicken Supreme (chicken pieces and ala King sauce).  And boy, I would never forget my husband's and 1 yr old's first taste of escargot!  We also had a fine bottle of Brouilly, which our server suggested.Food was actually simple and really unimpressive.  But, like I said, it was perfect for us that evening!And just to add a note to parents: There was no changing table inside the toilettes but you might want to try out what one mom did: she used the top of the deep freezers laying by the coat racks as her baby station.  I think it works well!

Went in not expecting much from this place, menu outside didn't seem particularly interesting, but it was open and we were hungry on Good Friday. I ordered the roast beef sandwich thinking I just wanted something basic and was disappointed they didn't have fries as an option. To my pleasant surprise the roast beef was delicious (I assumed I'd be getting some garbage grocery store cold cuts) and the garden salad was surprisingly satisfying. I generally dislike salads, but this one was so fresh, well-composed and with a nice understated dressing that I couldn't say enough good things about it. Wife and Boyd's had crepes which also went over well

We orders crepes and cheese fondue with sundry tomato. We are so full after all. The crepes are nice. I don't like the taste of the cheese fondue (probably the taste of wine or sundry tomato). I like that they have so many choices on crepes.

Discovered this awesome place back on my first trip to Montreal in 2008, then went back again this past summer on my second trip up to the city. Both times I ordered the crêpe La Cabane à sucre (consisted of egg, ham, and Quebec maple syrup), and both times, I was not disappointed! I also had the pleasure of taking a few tastes of my brothers cheese fondue, which was also very good, albeit very hot. Definitely do recommend if you find yourself walking through Old City!

I was a bit dissapointed with my first real crepe experience. The place has plenty of room with three floors but is still a very cramped environment .We walked in and sat and the waiters walked past us for about ten minutes before someone came over. For drinks, we got a bloody caesar and the cocoloco smoothie. They mistakenly made a bloody mary and informed us, which I was fine with. The drink though, was virtually all tomato juice and I couldn't taste any tabasco/pepper or vodka, and there was no celery or garnish. Probably the worst bloody mary I have ever had. The cocoloco was pretty good, but very artificial tasting. I got the crepe charlevoix, which was generous portion. Even though I was hungry, it wasn't that good. I do wish they had more meat options with their crepes. The dessert crepes looked very good but I wasn't in the mood for one. I tried the quiche which was decent. Overall, not worth the $50+ bill for a crepe, quiche, and two drinks.

My boyfriend and I stopped here on a whim.  Thank goodness we stayed for a table, the food was amazing.  If you like crepes and seafood you must try La Neptune.  It's a bit pricey,  but oh so good.  La Quebecois is also very good.  Very filling as well.

Absolutely divine crepes, very indulgent and yet not so filling that you feel stuffed afterwards.We were warmly greeted at the door by the hostess and immediately seated (a nice surprise at noon on a holiday Monday in the touristy part of town!) at a table in the middle of the room, then she promptly moved us to a table near the window as soon as she finished cleaning and resetting it, without us even asking.The service was quick and polite, coffee was refilled without us needing to ask and the crepes... well, they were delicious.I ordered Le Sonia, which was strawberries, bananas, vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. My husband had Le Jamaicaine, which was similar, but without strawberries. Both of us easily finished our crepes and one of the two scoops of ice cream, were satisfied and agreed that there was no way we could have had a savory crepe and then the sweet ones, so I think it's the type of place we'd return for a dessert or specifically for savory ones for a meal. The coffee was even very good (Cafe Brossard brand, I believe) and provided a nice balance to the dessert crepes.

Convenient location. Friendly staff. Extensive selection. We had three spongey crepes: ham with asparagus and bechamel sauce; egg, bacon, mushroom and cheese; and a dessert crepe with bananas and Nutella. The crepes were not light and airy but rather spongey. The fillings were average-- processed ham, etc. A disappointment overall.

Fell in for breakfast here after an early morning flght, workng on bascally no sleep. Good coffee, welcoming servers and very good crepes. Happy happy joy joy. And just in case I was too tired to remember I was in Montreal, my ham and brie crepe came with a little plastic cup of maple syrup on the side. Maple syrup...Montreal's all-natural GPS locator. Nice little boite for breakfast or lunch.

Loved this quaint little spot right in the midst of the Old Port. We sat inside right next to a wide open window; it was lovely. I ordered La Parisienne crèpe, DELICIOUS! All the other meals ordered within my party were also deemed fantastic. We also ordered a desert crèpe, so so good. If you're visiting in summer, I recommend the frozen cappuccino. Overall, food was 10/10 with good prices, good environment as well. Our server was so friendly and efficient as well! Definitely try this place.

Delightful meal and service. I got the smoked salmon crepe (healthy!) for dinner and the Jamaican crepe for dessert (decadent!). Oh, and the French Onion Soup was deliciously cheesy. Our waiter was fun and friendly.

This place looks like a small crêperie from the outside, but it's giant in the inside - 3 floors of dining rooms? It's more professional than I was expecting too, so obviously I got different results. Not that the crêpe is even close to bad, but you know, they just make the pastry, add some pre-cut fruits and cover it in chocolate sauce. This by any means can taste bad. But when the fruit is fresh cut it tastes better, when they make the crêpe with the fruit, everything tastes different (the fruits are a bit warm), etc. So, it's just a 3-star crêpe. I have had better ones. Service was standard, everything was three-star.

We went to this restaurant for a french breakfast since we love crepes, but it was a disappointment. The crepes were not good and the coffee was TERRIBLE. We were taken to the third floor where there was some construction going on and this guy was using a very loud drill. The waitress was unfriendly and even when we complained about the coffee she did not apologize or not charge us for it. Bad food and bad service and ambience. I would never go back here.

My husband & I vacationed in Montreal over  Labor Day weekend and this was one place friends consistently recommended for crepes. We came here after spending a long morning sight-seeing in Old Montreal. We were seated upstairs by a corner window that had a picturesque, postcard view. The service was quick and friendly.  We had a savory crepe with ham, asparagus & bechamel, and a sweet one with Nutella & strawberries. Also, two glasses of Riesling. Delicious & great ambience!
This was the perfect place to stop for crepes for dessert after seeing a show. Their Crepe Suzette, while not served flambé, was delicious.

this is the best thing that has ever happened to me. this beautiful french onion soup. my god. i took one sip and its like my soul drifted away into heaven and I was partying with jesus and I swear it is the best exerience. 20 STARS. GOODBLESS THIS PLACE.

Had read good reviews about this creperie so decided to stop in for a late night snack/dessert as I was walking through Old Montreal on a recent trip. Ordered the lobster bisque w/cognac which was amazing, and their La Laurentienne crepe (ham, Swiss cheese, asparagus, w/bechamel sauce). Absolutely delicious. Restaurant itself was nice and cozy with available upstairs seating. Very affordable. Highly recommended.
Small portion sizes, barely filling and average taste overall.
Typical tourist trap. Service was lousy and crepes were the worst I had in Montreal. There are way too many other places in Montreal to go to.

Great location in Old Montreal and the old-world feel of the restaurant add to its charm. Service was not great, but aside from that the food was pretty good. There are some nice salad option which can be tough to find so if you're looking for some good greens this is a good location for you. Lots of sweet and savory crepes and fondue options.I LOVED my Parisienne crepe which had apples, brie and of course some maple syrup. Many of the other crepes included cheese and some more cheese on top...I felt like my dinner option was sutto healthy.  Chocolate fondue is a must and one portion was very generous. Our dessert was accompanied by loads of fresh fruit, bits of crepe and marshmallow.

It could have been romantic place, almost. I went there when there during weekdays, when less tourist in the area. The food was good, and tasted better with the nice winter light coming from the big windows on the second floor.

Hard to make a crepe tough and chewy, but that's what we ended up with at Chez Suzette. Staff was polite, location convenient, creperie is multi-floor so can accommodate very large groups, but the crepes not so much. I ordered a banana and Nutella crepe which I've had many times before, but even that delicious filling combo couldn't overcome the cardboard texture of the premade or just overcooked crepe. My husband had the onion soup and rated it a little above average.
Nice crepes, service is capable and basic but ok. The ambience is almost like a  family owned and run cafe somewhere in Europe. Free wifi.

More like 2.5 stars. I really wanted to like this place more than I did. The setting couldn't be better on Rue Saint-Paul in touristy but historic Old Port. Got to sit on the second floor with a great view of the surrounding area. Waitress and service were excellent. Food on the other hand was questionable. Had a crepe with eggs, swiss, ham, bacon, and sausage topped with maple syrup. I feel like everything was good except the eggs themselves. Tasted like they either used "fake" eggs or powdered eggs. Horrible. Very disappointed. Probably wouldn't come back again

I had the most horrible experience in that restaurant... we arrived to the restaurant before 7... we didnt get our entree until 9... we had to ask and remind that we hadn't ate... all we ordered were cheese fondues... we saw people who came after us left already... and the quality of the fondue wasn't even good... i had better in NYC... the service was terrible as well... we asked the waitress to lite the candles for the fondue(she only lite 1 candle which the cheese wasn't even hot) she told us all the excuses that she couldn't lite them while there are like 5 candles underneath...At the end, i requested for the manager... her reason for havin us waited for the fondue was the restaurant was really busy... dun feel sorry at all...
Excellent place, and a big variety on the menu.  Crepes, fondue, and quiches.  A massive drink menu, too!  Highly recommended.
Very disappointing after reading good reviews.  Food is just OK and not something special you expect from this area.  Very over priced for what you get.
